original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes pa ni 'dod pa ni gzugs pa sogs pa yin la de nyid gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyong zhing goms par byed de bla na med pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba rnams kyis yon tan des cho ga bzhin
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes pa ni 'dod pa ni gzugs pa sogs pa yin la de nyid gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyong zhing goms par byed de bla na med pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba rnams kyis yon tan des cho ga bzhin
translated: The five sense objects are the objects of desire, and they are purified in the form of Vajra Form and so forth, and one should practice them.

original: du bdun pa las bshad pa'i cho gas so //
analyzed: du bdun pa las bshad pa'i cho gas so //
translated: Those who seek unexcelled enlightenment should, by means of those qualities, worship the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas with the five offerings, according to the rite explained in the seventh chapter.

original: rtag tu las dang po pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu las dang po pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du'o //
translated: Always means in all situations, such as when one is a beginner and so forth.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga rnams kyis kyang mchod pa na rnal 'byor pas myur zhing mgyogs par sangs rgyas nyid do thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga rnams kyis kyang mchod pa na rnal 'byor pas myur zhing mgyogs par sangs rgyas nyid do thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one worships with the five offerings, the yogi/nī will quickly, swiftly, attain omniscience, Buddhahood.

original: de nas zhes te thugs rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa na de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang sngags kyang gang yin zhes gdul bya'i the tshom yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes te thugs rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa na de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang sngags kyang gang yin zhes gdul bya'i the tshom yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Then, after the doubts of the disciples have been completely resolved, as to the characteristics and mantras of those [deities] who are consecrated by Vajra Mind and so forth, [the Bhagavān] declares, “The characteristics of the five sense objects are as follows.”

original: sngags rnams ni shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid thugs rdo rje la sogs pa dngos po yin la de'i sa bon ni btags pa las yin te /
analyzed: sngags rnams ni shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid thugs rdo rje la sogs pa dngos po yin la de'i sa bon ni btags pa las yin te /
translated: The mantras are the essence of wisdom and compassion, the vajra of mind, and so on, which are entities, and their seed is imputed.

original: de rnams kyi gsang ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gsang ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Their secret is the nature that is not the domain of experience of those who are not omniscient.

original: sngags rnams la dmigs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo la sogs pas ji ltar rnam par mi g-yeng bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sngags rnams la dmigs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo la sogs pas ji ltar rnam par mi g-yeng bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The focus on the mantras is the nondistraction by means of the nondual nature and so on.

original: de ltar sngags pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyang byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sngags pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyang byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the mantra practitioner will also bless his body, speech, and mind.

original: dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams las phul du byung bas rab ste gang las shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dri ma med pa'i bde ba chen po nyid kyis yid dga' ba'i phyir dang mgu ba
analyzed: dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams las phul du byung bas rab ste gang las shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid dri ma med pa'i bde ba chen po nyid kyis yid dga' ba'i phyir dang mgu ba
translated: The accomplishment of powers is the best of the mundane and supramundane powers, since it is the supreme joy of the mind by means of the stainless great bliss that is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: ni 'tshe ba med pa yang dag pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin pas 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ni 'tshe ba med pa yang dag pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin pas 'dod pa'o //
translated: is the nature of the true meaning of non-violence, and so is desired.

original: gang las thugs rje la sogs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid sngags pas dngos grub bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gang las thugs rje la sogs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid sngags pas dngos grub bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: From which, by the blessings of compassion and so forth, the mantra practitioner should accomplish the powers.

original: de nas rdzogs par bya zhing mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdzogs par bya zhing mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: Then, having completed them, they should be actualized.

original: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa gsum po rnams yang dag par sbyor te shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa gsum po rnams yang dag par sbyor te shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The three, the vajra of mind and so forth, are perfectly joined, characterized by the union of wisdom and means.

original: khyad par ci @67a * //🔽lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci @67a * // lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: sems de la dmigs pa yang yin te bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: sems de la dmigs pa yang yin te bdag med pa'o //
translated: That mind is also the object of observation, which is selflessness.

original: lus dang ngag dag la de dmigs pa yang yin la sna tshogs pa bdag med pa'i rnam pas bsgom pa yang gang la yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dag la de dmigs pa yang yin la sna tshogs pa bdag med pa'i rnam pas bsgom pa yang gang la yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: The body and speech are also the objects of observation of that, and the meditation is also various, by way of the aspect of selflessness.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang la lus dang ngag dang yid la dmigs pas don dam par rang bzhin mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang la lus dang ngag dang yid la dmigs pas don dam par rang bzhin mi dmigs so //
translated: Where the body, speech, and mind are the objects of observation, ultimately the nature is not observed.

original: des na nam mkha' bzhin du mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: des na nam mkha' bzhin du mnyam pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is equal to space.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa'i ngo bo dus thams cad du de ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa'i ngo bo dus thams cad du de ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reality of all phenomena is the essence of reflexive awareness, which is nondual, and it has always existed in that way.

original: de ni gang gi gnas yin te des na byang chub las ma gtogs par yang bsgom pa yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: de ni gang gi gnas yin te des na byang chub las ma gtogs par yang bsgom pa yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: That is the basis of what? Therefore, apart from enlightenment, there is no meditation.

original: gang 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i rgyan las 'jam dpal nyid byang chub yin la byang chub kyang 'jam dpal nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa'i rgyan las 'jam dpal nyid byang chub yin la byang chub kyang 'jam dpal nyid do zhes so //
translated: As it says in the Ornament of Mañjuśrī’s Buddha Field, “Mañjuśrī is enlightenment, and enlightenment is Mañjuśrī.”

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi lus te phul du byung ba'i rnal 'byor gang yin pa des na rnal 'byor pas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi lus te phul du byung ba'i rnal 'byor gang yin pa des na rnal 'byor pas mi dmigs so //
translated: The body of the nature of mantra is the supreme yoga, and therefore the yogin does not observe anything.

original: rnam par dpyad pa ni nges par bya ste 'di sngar brjod ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa ni nges par bya ste 'di sngar brjod ma thag pa'o //
translated: One should definitely analyze this, which was just mentioned above.

original: mdor na ste mdor bsdus pas so //
analyzed: mdor na ste mdor bsdus pas so //
translated: In brief, in brief.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i ngo bo ste de gsungs pa na nam mkha' lta bu'i ngo bo rdo rje gsum mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i ngo bo ste de gsungs pa na nam mkha' lta bu'i ngo bo rdo rje gsum mtshon par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the vajra body, etc., is like space. When that is stated, the nature like space should be illustrated by the three vajras.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni bla ma'i man ngag gi cho gas so //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni bla ma'i man ngag gi cho gas so //
translated: What is to be cultivated is by the rite of the guru's instruction.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Right application is the characteristic of entering into the meditative concentration of wisdom and means.

original: de nyid ting nge 'dzin du bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ting nge 'dzin du bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is to be made into meditative concentration.

original: 'dir yon tan gyi tshogs yin la ting nge 'dzin la sngags kyi sgo nas der brtags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yon tan gyi tshogs yin la ting nge 'dzin la sngags kyi sgo nas der brtags pa'o //
translated: Here, it is the assembly of qualities, and meditative concentration is imagined there by means of mantra.

original: de na zhes pa ni rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa bsgom par bya zhes brjod pa de la ci bsgom par bya ba zhes gdul bya'i dogs pa nges pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de na zhes pa ni rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa bsgom par bya zhes brjod pa de la ci bsgom par bya ba zhes gdul bya'i dogs pa nges pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: There refers to the five-colored jewel that is to be cultivated. After the disciples' doubt What is to be cultivated? is resolved, [the Bhagavān] says, The five-colored jewel should be cultivated.

original: slar yang don gzhan la brten nas don de nyid ni bzlas pa yin zhes pa'i tshul gyis zlos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slar yang don gzhan la brten nas don de nyid ni bzlas pa yin zhes pa'i tshul gyis zlos pa ma yin no //
translated: Again, based on another meaning, that very meaning is not a repetition in the manner of saying repetition is...

original: rgyu lnga dang ni rig pa lnga //
analyzed: rgyu lnga dang ni rig pa lnga //
translated: The five causes and the five intuitions

original: rdo rje zhes ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes ni bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as the vajra.

original: zhes pas rnam par byang ba'i phung po lnga dang me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid kyis de ston par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zhes pas rnam par byang ba'i phung po lnga dang me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid kyis de ston par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: Thus, the five aggregates of the purified realm and the mirror-like intuition, etc., are also the nature of that, and so it is the teacher of that.

original: rtse mo lnga gnyis kyi rdo rje phyag gis 'dzin par byed pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo lnga gnyis kyi rdo rje phyag gis 'dzin par byed pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the vajra-holder because it holds the vajra with two sets of five peaks in the hand.

original: mthar thug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi ngo bo phun sum @67b tshogs pa dang ldan pas dpal ldan yin te /🔽gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni nyams pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi ngo bo phun sum @67b tshogs pa dang ldan pas dpal ldan yin te / gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni nyams pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is glorious because it is endowed with the perfection of the nature of the stores of merit and intuition which is the nature of the perfected perfections.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis mchod pa ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis mchod pa ni mchod pa'o //
translated: It is the worship because it is the worship of all the Ones-Thus-Gone.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi de nyid mkhyen pas na kun mkhyen pa ste de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las mchog ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi de nyid mkhyen pas na kun mkhyen pa ste de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las mchog ste gtso bo'o //
translated: Because he knows the reality of all things, he is omniscient. For that very reason, he is supreme, the chief, among the buddhas, such as those of the perfection vehicle.

original: de nyid kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: He himself has declared this,

original: gzhan bdud la sogs pas ni ma yin la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gis mi gnod pa 'di rnams ni ston par byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan bdud la sogs pas ni ma yin la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gis mi gnod pa 'di rnams ni ston par byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: not some other, such as Māra, and it is not contradicted by direct perception, inference, or scripture. These are not capable of being taught,

original: de rnams kyang thams cad mkhyen pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang thams cad mkhyen pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they too would be omniscient.

original: bsgom par bya ba zhes pa ni bsgom pa de nyid de 'bras bu mchog ster bar byed pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba zhes pa ni bsgom pa de nyid de 'bras bu mchog ster bar byed pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: The object of meditation is that meditation itself, which is unsurpassed because it bestows the supreme result.

original: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa ni chos 'byung gi nang gi gzhal yas khang gi dbus su sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa ni chos 'byung gi nang gi gzhal yas khang gi dbus su sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'o //
translated: Residing in the middle of the realm of space means residing in the center of the immeasurable palace in the source of phenomena, on a multicolored lotus.

original: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gzugs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gzugs te /
translated: The Buddha is the form of Great Vajradhara.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin par brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin par brjod //
translated: The Buddha is called the vajra holder.🔽

original: ces pas so //
analyzed: ces pas so //
translated: The Buddha is said to be the Vajra Holder.

original: de yungs kar gyi tshad kha dog lnga pa'i byang chub kyi sems rin po che'o //
analyzed: de yungs kar gyi tshad kha dog lnga pa'i byang chub kyi sems rin po che'o //
translated: That is the precious bodhicitta, the size of a mustard seed, with five colors.

original: de'i nang du song ba'i 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i nang du song ba'i 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The moving and unmoving beings who enter into that are the essence of the realm of phenomena, the nature of all things that are stable and moving, the maṇḍala of the support and the supported.

original: ye shes kyi gnas yin te ye shes lnga la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi gnas yin te ye shes lnga la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: It is the abode of pristine consciousness, the reason for actualizing the Bhagavān, whose nature is the five pristine consciousnesses, and so on.

original: de'i ngo bo kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam par byin gyis brlabs pa ni ye shes kyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam par byin gyis brlabs pa ni ye shes kyis brtags pa'o //
translated: The blessing of the essence as color and so on is the examination by pristine consciousness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste bsgoms pa na de bsgom pa sngon du song bas lha thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste bsgoms pa na de bsgom pa sngon du song bas lha thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha’s body is Vajrasattva, because when meditating, all deities are perfected through the prior meditation on that.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya ste de'i steng du gnas te mi bskyod pa grub pa'i rgyur yang zla ba zhu ba de yongs su gyur pa las h'um yig go //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya ste de'i steng du gnas te mi bskyod pa grub pa'i rgyur yang zla ba zhu ba de yongs su gyur pa las h'um yig go //
translated: One should meditate on the orb of the sun, and on top of that, abiding, the moon melts, and from that complete transformation, the syllable hūṃ.

original: 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni gsum par bshad do //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni gsum par bshad do //
translated: The orbs of the wheel, jewel, and lotus are explained in the third [chapter].

original: rang 'od kyi shes rab spyan gyi rnam par yang dag par sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ste rnam pa zhes pa stobs kyis spyan ma nyid ni ma yin @68a * //
analyzed: rang 'od kyi shes rab spyan gyi rnam par yang dag par sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ste rnam pa zhes pa stobs kyis spyan ma nyid ni ma yin @68a * //
translated: That which is perfectly joined with the insight of one’s own light in the aspect of Locanā is Vairocana, not the eye of power called “aspect.”

original: no ; / rdo rje ni rtse lnga pa ste h'um yig las grub pa'i rang gi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: no ; / rdo rje ni rtse lnga pa ste h'um yig las grub pa'i rang gi rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is five-pointed, one’s own vajra created from the syllable hūṃ.

original: shes rab kyi padma aa las byung ba'i sna tshogs ze'u 'bru h'um yig las sprul pa'i 'dab ma brgyad pa la bsgom par bya zhes pa ni thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi padma aa las byung ba'i sna tshogs ze'u 'bru h'um yig las sprul pa'i 'dab ma brgyad pa la bsgom par bya zhes pa ni thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The lotus of insight is created from the syllable a, with a variegated pistil, and one should meditate on the eight-petaled lotus created from the syllable hūṃ. This should be understood in all [cases].

original: dang po yang ni 'di yin te rang gi lha grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po yang ni 'di yin te rang gi lha grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also the first [chapter], because it is for the creation of one’s deity.

original: sbyor bar byed pas na sbyor ba ste rang gi sa bon las skyes pa'i phyag mtshan yin la rin po che'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pas na sbyor ba ste rang gi sa bon las skyes pa'i phyag mtshan yin la rin po che'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The application is the hand implement born from one's seed, which one should meditate upon above the jeweled mandala.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The vajra of passion is Amitābha.

original: 'od zer dang ldan pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor te de bsgoms nas der don yod grub pa bsgom par bya'o zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: 'od zer dang ldan pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor te de bsgoms nas der don yod grub pa bsgom par bya'o zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: The sun mandala is endowed with light rays, and having meditated on that, one should meditate on Amoghasiddhi there, completing the verse.

original: sangs rgyas gnas ni zhi ba spro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnas ni zhi ba spro //
translated: The abode of the buddhas is peace.

original: 'khor ni zhes te dkyil 'khor ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni zhes te dkyil 'khor ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The circle is the nature of the mandala deities.

original: 'di bzhin du thams cad du yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bzhin du thams cad du yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way in all the other cases.

original: da ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi phyag mtshan gyi tshad des pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi phyag mtshan gyi tshad des pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now the author states the proper size of the hand implement in the subtle yoga:

original: autpala sngon po ma dog 'dra ba ;
analyzed: autpala sngon po ma dog 'dra ba ;
translated: The size of a blue lotus bud

original: / nas tsam ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnam 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: / nas tsam ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnam 'byor pa'o //
translated: The size of a pea is for the yogī of Akṣobhya, etc.

original: tsa na ka'i 'bru tshad ni padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa ste 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan pa'i'o //
analyzed: tsa na ka'i 'bru tshad ni padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa ste 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan pa'i'o //
translated: The measure of a mustard seed of Tsana is an eight-petaled red lotus, for the contemplator of Amitābha, etc.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: The measure of an eight-spoked wheel is a mustard seed, for the meditator on Vairocana, etc.

original: phyogs 'dis phyag mtshan gzhan la yang ci rigs par bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'khor lo la sogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis phyag mtshan gzhan la yang ci rigs par bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'khor lo la sogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By this method, one should meditate on the other hand-symbols as appropriate.

original: 'grub pa ni byang chub mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa ni byang chub mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the actualization of enlightenment.

original: gnas ni rten te phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: gnas ni rten te phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The place is the support, the subtle yoga.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nyams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nyams dga' ba'o //
translated: It is delightful because it is the nature of supreme joy.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: deng nas bzung ste gang cung zad //🔽bsgom bya legs par mnyam gzhag pas //
analyzed: deng nas bzung ste gang cung zad // bsgom bya legs par mnyam gzhag pas //
translated: From now on, whatever is to be meditated on🔽by the one well-equipoised

original: ting 'dzin ye shes kyis brtags pas //
analyzed: ting 'dzin ye shes kyis brtags pas //
translated: is examined by the wisdom of meditative concentration,

original: de dag thams cad brtan par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad brtan par 'gyur //
translated: and all that becomes firm.

original: zhes so // cis she na gang gi phyir thun mong dang cig shos kyi dngos grub rnams dang stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // cis she na gang gi phyir thun mong dang cig shos kyi dngos grub rnams dang stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi gnas yin no //
translated: Why? Because it is the abode of the common and uncommon powers and of the qualities such as the ten powers.

original: der zhes pa na brtan pa'i rtags mthong na'o //🔽byang chub la gnas pa'i rang 'od kyi shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: der zhes pa na brtan pa'i rtags mthong na'o // byang chub la gnas pa'i rang 'od kyi shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “There” means when the signs of stability are seen.

original: chos ni stobs la sogs pa'i gnas te de @68b dang de ni sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos ni stobs la sogs pa'i gnas te de @68b dang de ni sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: The abode of the Dharma is the abode of the ten powers, etc.

original: mtshan ma sna tshogs pa dang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma sna tshogs pa dang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the characteristics of the body, speech, and mind, which are marked by various signs.

original: de nas zhes pa ni mtshan ma thob pa'i sngags pas dus ci tsam gyis ci bya bas ji lta bu'i dngos grub ces gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni mtshan ma thob pa'i sngags pas dus ci tsam gyis ci bya bas ji lta bu'i dngos grub ces gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: “Then” means after the magician who has obtained the signs has completely resolved his disciples’ doubts as to how and when to perform the rites and what powers will result.

original: gsang ba'i de nyid ni mchod pa chen po rig pa'i brtul zhugs la brjod pa rig ma 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyod pas yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: gsang ba'i de nyid ni mchod pa chen po rig pa'i brtul zhugs la brjod pa rig ma 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyod pas yang dag par mchod de /
translated: The secret reality is the great offering, the conduct of awareness, which is the perfect offering through enjoying the five sense objects of the knowledge consort.

original: yang gi sgras bde bar gshegs pa rnams dang rang dang gzhan gyi lha'i rnam pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pas so /
analyzed: yang gi sgras bde bar gshegs pa rnams dang rang dang gzhan gyi lha'i rnam pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pas so /
translated: The word “also” indicates that one should enjoy the five sense objects such as form and so on with the sugatas and the deities of oneself and others.

original: brtson 'grus lnga dang bdud rtsi rnams rgyud phyi ma las bshad pa'i cho gas bza' ste bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid /
analyzed: brtson 'grus lnga dang bdud rtsi rnams rgyud phyi ma las bshad pa'i cho gas bza' ste bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid /
translated: One should eat the five nectars and the five exertions with the procedure explained in the Continuation of the Continuation of the Compendium of Practice.

original: tshad mas ma grub pas de rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i phyir dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid la zhugs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyis spang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas ma grub pas de rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i phyir dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid la zhugs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyis spang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not to be eaten because they are not established by valid knowledge, because they are imputed by thought, and because they are to be abandoned by the unsurpassed enlightenment of one who has entered into reality that is not just as it seems.

original: rnyed sla ba kha na ma tho ba med pa btsal ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i nyid kyi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed sla ba kha na ma tho ba med pa btsal ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i nyid kyi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is easy to obtain, because it is free from the suffering of searching for what is free from sin, and because it is endowed with inconceivable power, one attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: dngos po dang mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas mtshan ma thob nas zla ba drug tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas mtshan ma thob nas zla ba drug tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having obtained the sign through the wisdom born from listening to the reality of all things, one should meditate for six months.

original: de nyid bsgoms pas dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bya ba nan tan gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid bsgoms pas dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bya ba nan tan gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By meditating on that, the fruit of spiritual power, the activity of all beings is accomplished through practice.

original: bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi thugs sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi thugs sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: The unsurpassed reality is the mind of enlightenment, free from the stains of all obscurations.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa'i dam tshig rjes su bsgrubs pa'i bka' yongs su skyong bas tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dga' ba'i byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa'i dam tshig rjes su bsgrubs pa'i bka' yongs su skyong bas tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dga' ba'i byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the perfect assembly of the pledge of inconceivable power, by the protection of the command, by the swift attainment of the enlightenment of joy,

original: rang gi lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi go 'phang gis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i lam gyis bya ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi go 'phang gis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i lam gyis bya ba byas pa'o //
translated: by the path of the stage of one's own deity mandala, by the performance of the function of the path of all beings,

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pas gnas gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lus la sogs pa shin tu mnan te de las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pas gnas gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lus la sogs pa shin tu mnan te de las 'da' ba'o //
translated: by the direct realization of the vajra body and so forth, by the complete suppression of the transformed worldly body and so forth, by the transcendence of that,

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u drug pa'o /🔽// / de nas zhes pa ni theg pa gzhan las bcom ldan 'das @69a * //
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u drug pa'o / // / de nas zhes pa ni theg pa gzhan las bcom ldan 'das @69a * //
translated: is the sixth chapter of the Sri-Guhyasamaja-alamkara.

original: kyis 'dod pa bsten pa ni byang chub kyi bgegs su gsungs nas de 'dir yang ci de ltar yin nam zhes gdul bya'i dpyod pa rtogs pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: kyis 'dod pa bsten pa ni byang chub kyi bgegs su gsungs nas de 'dir yang ci de ltar yin nam zhes gdul bya'i dpyod pa rtogs pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Then, after the analysis of the disciples who think, The Lord has said that the enjoyment of desire is an obstacle to enlightenment in other vehicles, so is it so here also?

original: chen po yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis thams cad du son pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis thams cad du son pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great is also the reality realm, because it is all-pervading by nature.

original: dam tshig kyang 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig kyang 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is the commitment, because it is not to be transgressed.

original: rdul phra rab so so'i nan du chud pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste de ni de kho na nyid yin la zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po rigs lnga yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab so so'i nan du chud pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste de ni de kho na nyid yin la zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po rigs lnga yin te /
translated: The nature of the mandala that is contained in each atom is the great vajra holder, and that is reality. The five families are the great uncontaminated bliss.

original: de nyid rigs lngar brjod pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid rigs lngar brjod pa ste //
translated: It is said to be the five families.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
translated: In the Later Tantra.

original: kun du bzang po'i ngo bo yang yin te /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i ngo bo yang yin te /
translated: It is also the nature of Samantabhadra.

original: dka' ba kun du bzang po yang yin /
analyzed: dka' ba kun du bzang po yang yin /
translated: It is the universal excellence of all difficulties.

original: dam tshig de nyid ces brjod pa'i phyir de bsgom par bya ba nyid sngags kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig de nyid ces brjod pa'i phyir de bsgom par bya ba nyid sngags kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: It is the commitment reality, and because it is said to be meditated upon, it is the mantra conduct.

original: bsten pa ni byang chub mchog gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten pa ni byang chub mchog gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the reliance, because it is the cause of supreme enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa ste gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa ste gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: All enjoyments of desire are form and so forth, and they are the enjoyment of form vajra and so forth.

original: 'dod pa kun zhes shes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa kun zhes shes bya ste /
translated: The desire for all is to be known.

original: rdo rje bdag po de bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bdag po de bzhin no //
translated: The lord of the vajra is just so.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje la sogs drug / rdo rje bdag po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje la sogs drug / rdo rje bdag po zhes bshad do //
translated: The six, beginning with the vajra of form, are explained as the lord of the vajra.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
translated: This is from the Later Tantra.

original: de rnams yongs su longs spyod par 'dod pa las mi 'da' bar bsten pa 'dis sngar bshad pa'i rnal 'byor gyis snying rje dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid shes rab dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis myur du sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de rnams yongs su longs spyod par 'dod pa las mi 'da' bar bsten pa 'dis sngar bshad pa'i rnal 'byor gyis snying rje dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid shes rab dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis myur du sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: By this practice of not transgressing the enjoyment of those desires, one quickly attains buddhahood by the yoga explained above, through the nature of compassion and wisdom, characterized by union with the wisdom consort.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pa'i //🔽rnal 'byor ldan pa bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pa'i // rnal 'byor ldan pa bde bar 'gyur //
translated: The one endowed with yoga, enjoying all desires,🔽will be happy.

original: bde ba mnyam par 'jog gyur te //
analyzed: bde ba mnyam par 'jog gyur te //
translated: The mind, being happy, will become equipoised.

original: 'dis ni yang dang don rig 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dang don rig 'gyur //
translated: By this, one will know the meaning as it is.

original: bde ba'i sems ni mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur la mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur zhes lung las so //
analyzed: bde ba'i sems ni mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur la mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur zhes lung las so //
translated: The mind, being happy, will become equipoised, and by being equipoised, one will know the meaning as it is, just as it is, as it is said in the scriptures.

original: gang las de ltar yin pa des na rang gi bdag po'i rnal 'byor gyis bdag dang gzhan la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang las de ltar yin pa des na rang gi bdag po'i rnal 'byor gyis bdag dang gzhan la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by the yoga of one's own lord, one should worship oneself and others.

original: rang gi sgras ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi sgras ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: By the word one's own all the Tathagatas are also meant.

original: rjes su 'gro ba bstan nas ldog pa gsungs pa sdug bsngal ni rang gi mgo gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba bstan nas ldog pa gsungs pa sdug bsngal ni rang gi mgo gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having taught the forward order, he teaches the reverse order: Suffering is the cutting off of one's own head, etc.

original: nges pa ni lo ma za ba dang zla ba gcig tu smyung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni lo ma za ba dang zla ba gcig tu smyung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Certainty is eating leaves, fasting for a month, etc.

original: dka' ba ni me lnga bsten pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba ni me lnga bsten pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Difficulty is the practice of the five fires, etc.

original: slong mo za ba'i tshul gyis bzlas pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: slong mo za ba'i tshul gyis bzlas pa mi bya'o //
translated: One should not recite in the manner of begging.

original: slong @69b mos rnyed pa'i bza' ba la yang chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: slong @69b mos rnyed pa'i bza' ba la yang chags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be attached even to food obtained by begging.

original: ma nyams pa ni mtshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyams pa ni mtshang ba med pa'o //
translated: Unbroken means without fault.

original: yan lag ni lhan cig bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag ni lhan cig bya'o //
translated: Limb means together.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: Enjoyment of desire is form, etc.

original: sngags gang gis yin pa de bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags gang gis yin pa de bzlas par bya'o //
translated: By which mantra, that should be recited.

original: cis she na /
analyzed: cis she na /
translated: By what?

original: gang las sku dang gsung dang thugs bde bar gnas pas byang chub thob par 'gyur te yang dag par rnyed do //
analyzed: gang las sku dang gsung dang thugs bde bar gnas pas byang chub thob par 'gyur te yang dag par rnyed do //
translated: From that, one attains enlightenment, the bliss of body, speech, and mind, which is truly attained.

original: gzhan du zhes pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu rkyen dang bral bas mi 'grub ste bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po'i bka' las 'das pa'i phyir dang smod pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu rkyen dang bral bas mi 'grub ste bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po'i bka' las 'das pa'i phyir dang smod pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, one does not accomplish it without the co-operating causes and conditions, because one transgresses the word of the Blessed One of great compassion, and because one is contemptuous.

original: dus ma yin pa ni tshe ma zad par nges pa ma yin pa'i myong ba'i tshe 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las so //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa ni tshe ma zad par nges pa ma yin pa'i myong ba'i tshe 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las so //
translated: Untimely is the action of destruction at the time of experiencing the inevitable, without the life being exhausted.

original: 'chi ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Death is the suffering of the present life.

original: dmyal bar sreg pa ni ma mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: dmyal bar sreg pa ni ma mthong ba la'o //
translated: The burning in hell is in the future.

original: nges par ni brtan par te las rnams myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par ni brtan par te las rnams myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Certainly is firmly, because the actions are to be experienced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpal mchog dang po las /🔽dka' thub nges pa rnon po yis //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpal mchog dang po las / dka' thub nges pa rnon po yis //
translated: For that very reason, in the Shri Paramartha,

original: lus ni skams nas sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: lus ni skams nas sdug bsngal te //
translated: The body is emaciated by the austerities of strict vows, and is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal las ni sems g-yengs te //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni sems g-yengs te //
translated: The mind is distracted by suffering.

original: g-yengs pas dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yengs pas dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: By distraction, spiritual attainment goes elsewhere.

original: des na 'bad pa kun gyis ni //
analyzed: des na 'bad pa kun gyis ni //
translated: Therefore, by all means

original: sngags dang phyag rgya rjes grub byed //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya rjes grub byed //
translated: one should accomplish mantra and mudrā.

original: dka' thub nges min bde ba dang // dga' bas kyang ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: dka' thub nges min bde ba dang // dga' bas kyang ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: It should be accomplished by pleasure and joy, not by asceticism.

original: snga ma rnams kyi'ang lam 'di yin//
analyzed: snga ma rnams kyi'ang lam 'di yin//
translated: This is the path of the former ones.

original: zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni stobs la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni stobs la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Buddha means endowed with the qualities of strength and so forth.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid dri ma med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid dri ma med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa
translated: Unchanging means having the nature of the dharmadhātu without beginning or end, and the aspect of stainless great bliss with the nature of wisdom, which is non-abiding nirvāṇa.

original: ni mi 'gyur ba'o / de nyid kyi phyir na mchog go //
analyzed: ni mi 'gyur ba'o / de nyid kyi phyir na mchog go //
translated: That itself is unchanging, and for that very reason it is supreme.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na bsten pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na bsten pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'o //
translated: Since that is so, to be relied upon means the five sense objects.

original: rtag tu brjod ma thag pa'i ye shes don du gnyer ba'i 'dod chags can rnams kyi snying rje chen po'i chags pas sems can ma lus pa rnams la bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi chags pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu brjod ma thag pa'i ye shes don du gnyer ba'i 'dod chags can rnams kyi snying rje chen po'i chags pas sems can ma lus pa rnams la bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi chags pa'o //
translated: The attachment of the great compassion of those who are desirous, who constantly seek the aforementioned intuition, is the attachment of the Sugatas to all sentient beings.

original: bsten par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The objects of reliance are the Bodhisattvas, who are by nature the Buddhas Akashagarbha, etc.,

original: chags par bya ba ni byang chub nyi ma rnams te /🔽'od zer can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnam @70a * //
analyzed: chags par bya ba ni byang chub nyi ma rnams te / 'od zer can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnam @70a * //
translated: and the objects of attachment are the Bodhisattvas, the Buddhas, the Suns of Enlightenment,🔽who are by nature the purified aggregates of form, etc.,

original: par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: the Tathagatas, the Ladies of Spells.

original: ston mo sogs la ji ltar zhugs //
analyzed: ston mo sogs la ji ltar zhugs //
translated: How can one engage in the feast and so forth?

original: de ltar bdag 'dzin med na yang //
analyzed: de ltar bdag 'dzin med na yang //
translated: In the same way, even without self-grasping,

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi 'gal te //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi 'gal te //
translated: form, etc., are not contradictory.

original: rang gzhan don la blo gsal ldan //
analyzed: rang gzhan don la blo gsal ldan //
translated: One who is clear-minded with regard to the aims of self and other

original: sa la sogs pa med na yang //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa med na yang //
translated: even without earth, etc.,

original: ji ltar dang po bsgom pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar dang po bsgom pa yin //
translated: how can one practice the first stage?

original: gzhan gyi don sogs la gtad de //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sogs la gtad de //
translated: One who is intent on the aims of others, etc.,

original: gzugs sogs bsgom pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsgom pa de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the meditation on form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dgos pa yang //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dgos pa yang //
translated: The purpose of form and so on is

original: bsgom pa'i bde ba chen po ste //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i bde ba chen po ste //
translated: the great bliss of meditation,

original: mi bden brtags pa dang bral yin //
analyzed: mi bden brtags pa dang bral yin //
translated: free from the imagined, which is not real.

original: de nyid gzhan du nges ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du nges ma yin //
translated: It is not determined to be something other than that.

original: gzugs snang ba yi myong can ni //
analyzed: gzugs snang ba yi myong can ni //
translated: The experience of the appearance of form

original: med na myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: med na myong ba ma yin te /
translated: is not experienced if it does not exist.

original: rgya chen rgyun bde 'jig rten pa'i //
analyzed: rgya chen rgyun bde 'jig rten pa'i //
translated: The worldly enjoyments of vast and continuous bliss

original: byin pa rnams kyang 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: byin pa rnams kyang 'dod pa yin //
translated: are also desired.

original: rgya chen rgyun bde'i rnam pa yi //
analyzed: rgya chen rgyun bde'i rnam pa yi //
translated: The aspect of vast and continuous bliss

original: gzhan gyi don bdag nus pa la //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bdag nus pa la //
translated: is the ability to benefit others.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags sogs ma skyes //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags sogs ma skyes //
translated: How is it that attachment and so on are not produced?

original: de ltar sngar ni nges par byas //
analyzed: de ltar sngar ni nges par byas //
translated: In that way, it was previously ascertained.

original: gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar mkho ba'i bde //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar mkho ba'i bde //
translated: The bliss that is necessary for form and so on

original: myong ba bdag nyid du ni rab bsgrubs 'di //
analyzed: myong ba bdag nyid du ni rab bsgrubs 'di //
translated: is well established in the nature of experience.🔽When it arrives there, it is established.

original: dun du son par de ni grub yin dang // nga ru 'dzin pa'i gnas brten byang chub kyi //
analyzed: dun du son par de ni grub yin dang // nga ru 'dzin pa'i gnas brten byang chub kyi //
translated: The basis of the abode of self-grasping is

original: de ni nye bar mkho dang bral ba yin //

original: de yis thob min legs pa'i steng pa de //
analyzed: de yis thob min legs pa'i steng pa de //

original: nye bar mkho ba la ni chung yang 'dir //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba la ni chung yang 'dir //

original: de ni 'phel bar yang dag skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni 'phel bar yang dag skye mi 'gyur //
translated: It does not truly arise as increased.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don ni bsags pa 'di //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don ni bsags pa 'di //

original: de yis rab tu 'bad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yis rab tu 'bad par bya ba ste /
translated: It is to be diligently applied.

original: 'dir ni yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'dir ni yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin //

original: mchog dga'i bde ba yang dag mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog dga'i bde ba yang dag mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: The bliss of supreme joy is truly seen.

original: 'khor ba srid kyi 'gro ba gsum po la //
analyzed: 'khor ba srid kyi 'gro ba gsum po la //
translated: In the three realms of existence in samsara,

original: khyab pa'i rgyal po thob par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: khyab pa'i rgyal po thob par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: one attains the pervasive king.

original: de ni myong min bsal ba ma yin pa //
analyzed: de ni myong min bsal ba ma yin pa //
translated: It is not experienced, not removed,

original: rtog min bya ba ma yin dang bral ba //
analyzed: rtog min bya ba ma yin dang bral ba //
translated: not conceptual, free from action.

original: grol ba ltar snang yod pas thams cad ni //
analyzed: grol ba ltar snang yod pas thams cad ni //
translated: Since there is apparent liberation, all

original: rnam par dag pa yang ni lhag bcas mchog //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang ni lhag bcas mchog //
translated: are also pure with remainder.

original: de nyid phyir na nges par byang chub rgyu //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na nges par byang chub rgyu //
translated: For that very reason, it is definitely the cause of enlightenment.

original: gzhan spangs nyid ni nges par bstan par 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan spangs nyid ni nges par bstan par 'dod //
translated: Abandoning others, it is definitely taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi de nyid nges gsungs pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi de nyid nges gsungs pa //
translated: The Bhagavān's definitive statement on reality

original: nges pa nyid ni sku la sogs pa yin //
analyzed: nges pa nyid ni sku la sogs pa yin //
translated: is definitely the body and so forth.

original: ji ltar myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ston par 'dod pas gsungs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ston par 'dod pas gsungs pa //
translated: He says this because he wishes to show that form, etc. are quickly attained to the state of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gzugs rnam pa gsum stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ste rnam par thar @70b pa'i sgo'i dbye bas shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa ni kha cig go //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa gsum stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ste rnam par thar @70b pa'i sgo'i dbye bas shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa ni kha cig go //
translated: Some believe that the three kinds of form should be known as emptiness, signless and wishless, according to the analysis of the doors of liberation.

original: dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gi dbye bas rnal 'byor pa rnams dman pa la yang yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams la 'gal ba dang mi 'gal ba spang ba'o //
analyzed: dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gi dbye bas rnal 'byor pa rnams dman pa la yang yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams la 'gal ba dang mi 'gal ba spang ba'o //
translated: The inferior, middling and superior forms are distinguished in order to show that the yogins should not be unhappy with the inferior, nor should they be averse to or attracted to agreeable and disagreeable forms respectively.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang gzhan gyi chos thams cad shes par byed do zhes rgyal ba'i yum las gsungs so zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang gzhan gyi chos thams cad shes par byed do zhes rgyal ba'i yum las gsungs so zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others believe that it is said in the Mother of the Victorious Ones that one should know all the dharmas of one's own and others' characteristics.

original: sna tshogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir rdul phra rab ma lus pa'i 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir rdul phra rab ma lus pa'i 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor tshogs pa'o //
translated: The various [bodies] are the collection of the mandalas of the assemblies of all the subtle particles, because of being the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: gang gsungs pa langs nas dag pa'i sems la zhes pa la sogs pa nas phyin ci log gi rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa langs nas dag pa'i sems la zhes pa la sogs pa nas phyin ci log gi rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhes so //
translated: As for what was said [above], “arising from the pure mind,” and so forth, up to “free from mistaken concepts,”

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa la mtshan ma thob pas rjes su dran pa bcu drug gsungs pa /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa la mtshan ma thob pas rjes su dran pa bcu drug gsungs pa /
translated: [the Bhagavān] taught the sixteen recollections for those who have attained the signs in subtle yoga, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa sbyor //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa sbyor //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha is the application,

original: zhes pa nas ji srid du /
analyzed: zhes pa nas ji srid du /
translated: and so forth, up to

original: dam tshig rjes su dran pa sbyor //
analyzed: dam tshig rjes su dran pa sbyor //
translated: the recollection of the commitments is the application.

original: bsgoms nas byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgoms nas byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: Having meditated, one will attain enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief explanation.

original: de la sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: Therein, “the Buddha,” and so forth, is the extensive explanation.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i skye bo spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i skye bo spangs pa'o //
translated: “Solitude” is the abandonment of people of dissimilar type.

original: mchod pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Worship” is meditative equipoise.

original: byin gyis rlabs kyis gnas gsum ni //
analyzed: byin gyis rlabs kyis gnas gsum ni //
translated: The three places of consecration

original: zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i dgang ba dang yi ge h'um la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i thugs rdo rje la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang / a'a: yig byas pa'i ze 'bru dang aom yig gis sprul pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i dgang ba dang yi ge h'um la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i thugs rdo rje la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa dang / a'a: yig byas pa'i ze 'bru dang aom yig gis sprul pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This is the consecration of the mind-vajra, etc. , preceded by the inflation of the eye, etc. , and the consecration with the syllable hum, etc. , and the meditation on the pistil cup made of the syllable a, and the eight-petaled lotus produced from the syllable om.

original: rang gi rtags la yang h'um gis sprul pa'i padma r'a ga'i kha dog gi rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje'i rnam pa'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: rang gi rtags la yang h'um gis sprul pa'i padma r'a ga'i kha dog gi rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje'i rnam pa'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the sign is the five-pointed vajra at the tip of the lotus produced from the syllable hum, the color of passion.

original: rang gi lta'i kha dog rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rnam pa'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: rang gi lta'i kha dog rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rnam pa'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that it is the color of one’s eye, in the form of a single-pointed vajra.

original: byang chub kyi sems brtan par bya ba'i don du gzhug pa la yi ge phat do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems brtan par bya ba'i don du gzhug pa la yi ge phat do //
translated: The syllable phat is for the purpose of retention of the bodhicitta.

original: aom gyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni nor ba'o //
analyzed: aom gyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni nor ba'o //
translated: The consecration with the syllable om is the best.

original: phyogs bcur 'gro ba'i don byed pa la 'jug pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pa'i 'od zer gyis khyab pa'i rdo rje dang padma'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur 'gro ba'i don byed pa la 'jug pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pa'i 'od zer gyis khyab pa'i rdo rje dang padma'o //
translated: The vajra and lotus are pervaded by light rays in the aspect of the five transcendent lords, which enter to perform the welfare of living beings in the ten directions.

original: dge ba'i 'bru 'phel ba dang gti mug gi mun pa sel bar byed pa dang chos mthun pas zla ba'i 'od zer bzhin du yang dag par 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bru 'phel ba dang gti mug gi mun pa sel bar byed pa dang chos mthun pas zla ba'i 'od zer bzhin du yang dag par 'bar ba'o //
translated: It is perfectly blazing like the light rays of the moon, because it is similar to the moon in increasing the seed of virtue and dispelling the darkness of delusion.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir yid du 'ong ba'i @71a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir yid du 'ong ba'i @71a * //
translated: For this very reason, it is delightful.

original: rig ma de bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rig ma de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate that knowledge woman.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The Buddha is Vairochana.

original: rdo rje chos ni 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni 'od dpag med do //
translated: Vajra Dharma is Amitabha.

original: rdo rje nges 'byed shes rab ste //
analyzed: rdo rje nges 'byed shes rab ste //
translated: Vajra discernment is wisdom.

original: sems dpa' 'dir ni rig byar brjod //
analyzed: sems dpa' 'dir ni rig byar brjod //
translated: The hero is said to be known here.

original: ces te rdo rje sems dpa' 'dir brjod pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: ces te rdo rje sems dpa' 'dir brjod pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The hero mentioned here as Vajrasattva is Akshobhya.

original: rigs ni rigs lnga'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: rigs ni rigs lnga'i lha rnams so //
translated: The family is the deities of the five families.

original: khro bo ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wrathful ones are Yamantaka and so forth.

original: spro zhes pa ni phyogs bcu rnams su sems can gyi don byas te slar bsdu'o //
analyzed: spro zhes pa ni phyogs bcu rnams su sems can gyi don byas te slar bsdu'o //
translated: Emanate means that having performed the welfare of living beings in the ten directions, they are reabsorbed.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba dang thim zhing brtan par bsgom pa ni nges par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba dang thim zhing brtan par bsgom pa ni nges par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditation on the emanation, gathering, and stability is definitely to be done.

original: dam tshig ni gzhan gang yang rung ba cig dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'o ;
analyzed: dam tshig ni gzhan gang yang rung ba cig dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'o ;
translated: The pledge is any one of the others, the lord of the mandala.

original: / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la /
analyzed: / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la /
translated: As for “Vajrasattva,”

original: 'ang gi sgras ni gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni gzhan yang ngo //
translated: the word “also” means “and the others.”

original: dkyil 'khor rnam pa zhes ni dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i dus so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnam pa zhes ni dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i dus so zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the “mandala” is the time of the accomplishment of the mandala.

original: rtag tu mnyam gzhag rnal 'byor pa yis yid //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam gzhag rnal 'byor pa yis yid //
translated: The yogi/nī who is always in meditative equipoise

original: 'khor lo bris pa'i 'khor lo yang mi bya //
analyzed: 'khor lo bris pa'i 'khor lo yang mi bya //
translated: should not make a wheel by drawing a wheel.🔽The rite of worship and so forth

original: rang gi byang chub sems las skyes pa dang// mchod pa la sogs pa yi chog yang //🔽zhes gzhan dag ste de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi byang chub sems las skyes pa dang// mchod pa la sogs pa yi chog yang // zhes gzhan dag ste de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: arises from one’s bodhicitta.

original: ye shes dbang thob kyis byas te //
analyzed: ye shes dbang thob kyis byas te //
translated: Others say that the wheel is made by one who has obtained the empowerment of pristine awareness,

original: sems nyid kyis ni 'khor lo gsum //
analyzed: sems nyid kyis ni 'khor lo gsum //
translated: the three wheels are from one’s mind,

original: byin rlabs kyis ni 'khor lo ste //
analyzed: byin rlabs kyis ni 'khor lo ste //
translated: the wheel is by the consecration,

original: gang phyir rang dang gzhan la snang //
analyzed: gang phyir rang dang gzhan la snang //
translated: because it appears to oneself and others.

original: 'dir ni 'jug ste gang snang ba //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jug ste gang snang ba //
translated: Here, it is said that whatever appears

original: rmi lam gsal ba bzhin du 'dod ;
analyzed: rmi lam gsal ba bzhin du 'dod ;
translated: Just as one remembers a dream clearly.

original: / gang phyir sems kyi tshul bstan pas //
analyzed: / gang phyir sems kyi tshul bstan pas //
translated: Because the way of mind is taught,

original: de ni mchog tu shes par bya //
analyzed: de ni mchog tu shes par bya //
translated: it should be understood as supreme.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa re re yongs su gang ba ni grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa re re yongs su gang ba ni grub pa yin te /
translated: The accomplishment is that each Tathāgata is completely filled by the natures of Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, and Akṣobhya, which are the form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness aggregates, respectively.

original: sku gang 'dra ba ci 'dra ba nyid du bdag kyang gyur cig ces smon lam btab nas bsgom pa ni sku rjes su dran pa'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sku gang 'dra ba ci 'dra ba nyid du bdag kyang gyur cig ces smon lam btab nas bsgom pa ni sku rjes su dran pa'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of recollection of body is the cultivation of the aspiration “May I become like that, with a body like that.”

original: gang de bzhin du chos dang don dang nges tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das rdo rje chos kyi ye shes te de 'dra bar bdag kyang zhes te smon lam btab la bsgom pa byas pa na chos 'dzin pa
analyzed: gang de bzhin du chos dang don dang nges tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das rdo rje chos kyi ye shes te de 'dra bar bdag kyang zhes te smon lam btab la bsgom pa byas pa na chos 'dzin pa
translated: Just like the wisdom of the Bhagavat Vajradharma, which has the nature of the correct and discerning awareness of Dharma, meaning, etymological interpretation, and confidence, may I also be like that.

original: dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one makes this aspiration and practices meditation, one will become like a Dharma holder.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ci 'dra bar thugs dri ma med pa'i rnam par byang ba ci 'dra ba nyid du bdag kyang zhes bsams nas bsgoms pa na rdo rje 'dzin pa dang @71b 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ci 'dra bar thugs dri ma med pa'i rnam par byang ba ci 'dra ba nyid du bdag kyang zhes bsams nas bsgoms pa na rdo rje 'dzin pa dang @71b 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as Vajrasattva is, and just as the stainless purity of mind is, may I also be like that. When one thinks this and practices meditation, one will become like a vajra holder.

original: da ni nam mkha' ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang sems can rnams kyang mtshan nyid gcig nyid kyis zhes pa'i rigs pa la brten nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni nam mkha' ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang sems can rnams kyang mtshan nyid gcig nyid kyis zhes pa'i rigs pa la brten nas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, based on the reasoning that just as space is, so too are buddhas and sentient beings, with the same characteristic, it is said:

original: sems gang rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba sems can rnams kyi yin te lus dang ngag dang rnam par shes pa brgyad kyis kyang 'khor ba pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems gang rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba sems can rnams kyi yin te lus dang ngag dang rnam par shes pa brgyad kyis kyang 'khor ba pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The mind that is naturally pure is that of sentient beings, and it is endowed with the characteristics of cyclic existence by way of body, speech, and the eight consciousnesses.

original: de nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du 'gro ba'i dang tshul can de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i ye shes can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dri ma dang bral ba'i rnam par byang ba
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du 'gro ba'i dang tshul can de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i ye shes can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dri ma dang bral ba'i rnam par byang ba
translated: That very [mind] is the suchness of the tathāgatas, which is endowed with the mode of being that is equal to space by being free from unreal imagination, and it is endowed with the wisdom that is of one taste in suchness, which is free from stains and completely pure.

original: ltar bdag kyang de dang 'dra ba der 'gyur zhes par bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: ltar bdag kyang de dang 'dra ba der 'gyur zhes par bsgom pa ni /
translated: Just so, may I also become like that.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra bar 'gyur zhes 'jug go //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra bar 'gyur zhes 'jug go //
translated: One should engage in the meditation with the thought, May I become like Vajrasattva.

original: sngags kyi rdo rje ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rdo rje ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The mantra vajra is Amitābha.

original: sngags kyi don bsgom pa'i bzlas pa ni sku rjes su 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi don bsgom pa'i bzlas pa ni sku rjes su 'dra ba ste /
translated: The recitation that is the meditation on the meaning of the mantra is the imitation of the body.

original: tshig dang sku bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang sku bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the meditation on the words and the body.

original: bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar gyur cig ces so ;
analyzed: bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar gyur cig ces so ;
translated: One should meditate with the thought, May I also become like that.

original: / bsgoms pas 'gyur ba yin te sngags 'dzin pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: / bsgoms pas 'gyur ba yin te sngags 'dzin pa lta bur ro //
translated: It is by cultivation, like the mantra-holder.

original: dam tshig ni snyoms par 'jug pa ste cho gas ni rgyud phyi ma las brjod pas so //
analyzed: dam tshig ni snyoms par 'jug pa ste cho gas ni rgyud phyi ma las brjod pas so //
translated: The pledge is the meditative concentration, and the rite is the one described in the Continuation of the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: bdud rtsi byed pa ni gsod pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi byed pa ni gsod pa'o //
translated: The nectar-making is the killing.

original: 'bras bu ni sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa ste /
translated: The fruit is the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de don du gnyer ba yod na btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba yod na btung bar bya'o //
translated: If one is intent on that, one should drink.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos grub myur du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos grub myur du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one will quickly achieve power.

original: dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang 'di yin la pha rol ni phul du phyin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang 'di yin la pha rol ni phul du phyin pa yang yin te /
translated: This is the wisdom born of hearing, contemplation, and meditation on the reality of all things, and it is also the perfection of the other side.

original: yang dag par shes par bya ba sa de nyid dam tshig yin zhing 'bras bu yin te 'dis ni lam dang gzhung yang yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par shes par bya ba sa de nyid dam tshig yin zhing 'bras bu yin te 'dis ni lam dang gzhung yang yin no //
translated: The reality of the stage to be understood is the pledge and the fruit. This is the path and the scripture.

original: thams cad ni zag pa med pa des nam skyes pa dang zag pa med pa ste de rnams kyi rten gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni zag pa med pa des nam skyes pa dang zag pa med pa ste de rnams kyi rten gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: All are born from that, and are without outflows. The support of those is the grasped and the grasper.

analyzed: chags sdang las byung rnon po dang // dka' dang lta ba yongs su 'dzin //
translated: From attachment and aversion, there is sharpness, difficulty, and grasping of views.

original: de las byung ba rtsod pa rnams //
analyzed: de las byung ba rtsod pa rnams //

original: dngos po khas blangs yod pas yin //
analyzed: dngos po khas blangs yod pas yin //

original: zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pas so //

original: dngos po ni gnyis yin no zhes rgyal ba'i yum las so //
analyzed: dngos po ni gnyis yin no zhes rgyal ba'i yum las so //

analyzed: thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mun pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: All are naturally luminous, free from the darkness of grasped and grasper.

original: des na byang chub ni sngar med pa'i mngon par byang chub par bya ba med do //
analyzed: des na byang chub ni sngar med pa'i mngon par byang chub par bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, enlightenment is not something previously nonexistent that is to be newly realized.

original: de mngon par byang chub par byed pa'o mngon par rtogs @72a * //
analyzed: de mngon par byang chub par byed pa'o mngon par rtogs @72a * //
translated: It is the realization of that.

original: pa ni lam ste rang gi sems las ma gtogs pa de yang med do //
analyzed: pa ni lam ste rang gi sems las ma gtogs pa de yang med do //
translated: Realization is the path, and that does not exist apart from one’s mind.

original: rgyu yi dngos pos rgyu yin la //
analyzed: rgyu yi dngos pos rgyu yin la //
translated: By the nature of being a cause, it is a cause.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos pos 'bras ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos pos 'bras ma yin //
translated: By the nature of being a result, it is not a result.

original: 'di ni rgyu 'bras dngos po ru //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu 'bras dngos po ru //
translated: This is the reality of cause and effect.

original: rang gi sems ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni snang ba yin //
translated: One’s mind is the appearance.

original: rang gi sems nyid sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid sangs rgyas te //
translated: One’s mind itself is buddhahood,

original: rtogs par bya ba'ang sems nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'ang sems nyid do //
translated: and what is to be realized is also mind itself.

original: zhes dpal thams cad gsang ba las so //
analyzed: zhes dpal thams cad gsang ba las so //

original: khams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid de 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: khams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid de 'khor ba'o //
translated: The characteristics of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness are saṃsāra.

original: der yang sems can rnams don dam par 'byung ba ma yin te kun rdzob tu de rnam par gzhag pa yin pas so //
analyzed: der yang sems can rnams don dam par 'byung ba ma yin te kun rdzob tu de rnam par gzhag pa yin pas so //
translated: And there, sentient beings are not ultimately born, because they are conventionally established.

original: sems ni 'od gsal nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: sems ni 'od gsal nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Since the mind is clear light,

original: nyon mongs rnams ni glo bur pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnams ni glo bur pa //
translated: the afflictions are adventitious.

original: zhes rgyal ba byams pas gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgyal ba byams pas gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is taught by the Victor Maitreya.

original: sems 'dir rang bzhin 'od gsal te //
analyzed: sems 'dir rang bzhin 'od gsal te //
translated: This mind is clear light by nature,

original: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba //
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba //
translated: and the defilements are adventitious.

original: zhes rnam 'grel las so //
analyzed: zhes rnam 'grel las so //
translated: Thus it is in the Pramaṇavarttika.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes lung las so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes lung las so //
translated: “O sons of the Victor, this three-realm cosmos is mind only.” Thus it is in the scriptures.

original: sems tsam nyid du rnam gzhag pa //
analyzed: sems tsam nyid du rnam gzhag pa //
translated: The presentation as mind only

original: ma skyes pa rung smra'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rung smra'o //
translated: is suitable for the unproduced.

original: zhes lang kar gshegs pa las te gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa'i nges pa brjod ma thag pas ma skyes pa rjes su dran pa ni 'dir de bstan par bya ba'i don rjes su dran pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes lang kar gshegs pa las te gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa'i nges pa brjod ma thag pas ma skyes pa rjes su dran pa ni 'dir de bstan par bya ba'i don rjes su dran pa 'di yin no //
translated: Thus, in the Descent into Laṅkā, non-production is recalled here as the meaning to be taught by the immediately preceding statement of the definition of non-duality.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni de bzhin nyid la yang mi dmigs pa yin te gang gi phyir med pas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni de bzhin nyid la yang mi dmigs pa yin te gang gi phyir med pas so //
translated: Signlessness is the non-apprehension of suchness, because it does not exist.

original: brjod par byed pa dang bral bas mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par byed pa dang bral bas mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is unchanging because it is free from expression.

original: gnyis su med pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bas so //

original: gnyis su med pa ma yin pa ni kun rdzob tu yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ma yin pa ni kun rdzob tu yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-non-duality is the existence of unreal imagination even conventionally.

original: de kho na nyid du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir shin tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir shin tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is extremely stainless because it abandons the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their traces in reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhi ba nyid kyis nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhi ba nyid kyis nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like space because of just that peace.

original: ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs rjes su dran pa 'di dag las srid pa dang zhi ba la rab tu mi gnas pas chos nyid kyis de dag mnyam par ro gcig pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ste lam bstan pa yin
analyzed: ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs rjes su dran pa 'di dag las srid pa dang zhi ba la rab tu mi gnas pas chos nyid kyis de dag mnyam par ro gcig pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ste lam bstan pa yin
translated: Just as it is, these recollections of wisdom and means are taught to be the path of non-abiding nirvana, because they are equal and of one taste with reality, not abiding in either existence or peace.

original: no // lo grangs bcu gnyis lon pa ni 'dir mtshon pa ste gti mug gi rigs la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: no // lo grangs bcu gnyis lon pa ni 'dir mtshon pa ste gti mug gi rigs la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The age of twelve is an illustration here, and also for the type of delusion and so forth.

original: sems brtan pa ni mi g-yo bar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi smon pa dang ldan pa dang rnal 'byor pa la gus pa'o//
analyzed: sems brtan pa ni mi g-yo bar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi smon pa dang ldan pa dang rnal 'byor pa la gus pa'o//
translated: Firm mind is having unwavering aspiration for unexcelled awakening and respect for the yogi.

original: @72b rigs kyi sbyor ba rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: @72b rigs kyi sbyor ba rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: This is the analysis of the application of the family.

original: gang gi rigs la rig ma gang yang rnal 'byor du bstan pas de dang lhan cig rnal 'byor de bya ste de dang bde bar gshegs pa yang chog ji lta bar mchod par bya'o //
