translated: Vajra is itself the power, and he is the teacher of that.

original: dam tshig ni rin po che tog gi dkyil 'khor 'di yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig ni rin po che tog gi dkyil 'khor 'di yin no //
translated: The commitment is this maṇḍala of Ratnaketu.

original: rtsub pa'i tshig la sogs pa ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras de'i gdul bya rjes su gzung ba'i phyir phra ma dang tshig 'khyal pa dag go zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: rtsub pa'i tshig la sogs pa ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras de'i gdul bya rjes su gzung ba'i phyir phra ma dang tshig 'khyal pa dag go zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that harsh speech and so on are slander and idle speech, respectively, because of the word “and so on” [in the root text], in order to care for those to be tamed by that.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i tshig las gzhan pa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis thams cad la rnam par thams cad du brdzun du smra ba spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i tshig las gzhan pa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis thams cad la rnam par thams cad du brdzun du smra ba spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Apart from the words that benefit others, in this context all bodhisattvas abandon lying in all ways and to all beings.

original: gzhan du yang brdzun du smra ba spong ba la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du yang brdzun du smra ba spong ba la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They also encourage others to abandon lying.

original: gzhan gsum po la yang 'di bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gsum po la yang 'di bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The other three should be understood in the same way.

original: thugs rjer ldan pa don gzigs pas //
analyzed: thugs rjer ldan pa don gzigs pas //
translated: The compassionate one, who sees the purpose,

original: bkag pa rnams kyang rjes su gnang //🔽zhes so // nyes par spyod pa khyod ni skyes bu rmongs pa drug ste rnams //
analyzed: bkag pa rnams kyang rjes su gnang // zhes so // nyes par spyod pa khyod ni skyes bu rmongs pa drug ste rnams //
translated: also allows what is prohibited.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas so //
translated: The Blessed One said, “You who engage in negative actions are a fool, a fool who is bound for the lower realms.”

original: skye bo 'phya ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: skye bo 'phya ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis bkag pa yin te /
translated: It is prohibited because it is a cause for others to criticize.

original: skye bo 'phya ba de nyid kyis so sor thar pa la sogs pa'i sdom pa gsum po la yang ji ltar brjod pa'i rnal 'byor ma tshang ba la mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa sngon du song bas phyis bslab pa'i gnas rnams bcas pa
analyzed: skye bo 'phya ba de nyid kyis so sor thar pa la sogs pa'i sdom pa gsum po la yang ji ltar brjod pa'i rnal 'byor ma tshang ba la mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa sngon du song bas phyis bslab pa'i gnas rnams bcas pa
translated: By that very criticism, the three vows such as the vow of individual liberation are also established as incomplete in the yoga as described, and thus later the bases of training are established as transgressed.

original: yin la sngar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yin la sngar ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not so before,

original: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid la dgongs pas so //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid la dgongs pas so //
translated: because the Buddha intended the reality that is naturally completely pure, just as things abide.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal ba'i yum las ji srid du gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar dge ba ma yin zhing mi dge ba yang ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal ba'i yum las ji srid du gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar dge ba ma yin zhing mi dge ba yang ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because the Mother of Conquerors says, “As long as there is form, there is neither virtue nor nonvirtue,” and so on.

original: des na stong pa nyid la sogs pa bsgoms pa sngon du song bas ltung ba thams cad gdon pa la /
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid la sogs pa bsgoms pa sngon du song bas ltung ba thams cad gdon pa la /
translated: Therefore, in order to remove all downfalls by first cultivating emptiness and so on,🔽the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras says:

original: stong nyid so sor rtog pa yis //🔽zhes mdo sde rgyan las so //
analyzed: stong nyid so sor rtog pa yis //🔽zhes mdo sde rgyan las so //
translated: Through discriminating emptiness,

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rnal 'byor pas bde ba chen po'i rnam pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po rang gi thugs kar dmigs par bya ste de dang de'i gdul bya rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bkag pa de dag thams cad nyid bsten pa na rnam
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rnal 'byor pas bde ba chen po'i rnam pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po rang gi thugs kar dmigs par bya ste de dang de'i gdul bya rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bkag pa de dag thams cad nyid bsten pa na rnam
translated: The yogi/nī of the three samādhis should visualize the form of great bliss, the Great Vajradhara, in his/her heart, and in order to take care of those disciples of him/her, when all of those prohibitions are relied upon,

original: pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid thams cad rtogs pa'i ngo bo me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid de dang de'i rang gi lha'i 'khor lo mngon sum du bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid thams cad rtogs pa'i ngo bo me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid de dang de'i rang gi lha'i 'khor lo mngon sum du bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: the nature of the realization of all thatness of all aspects, the nature of the mirror-like pristine awareness, etc., should be actualized as the wheel of his/her own deity.🔽As long as there is physical distraction

original: ji srid lus kyi rnam g-yeng dang // tshig ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang //
analyzed: ji srid lus kyi rnam g-yeng dang // tshig ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang //
translated: and speech arises,

original: de srid sngags @82b dang phyag rgyar des //
analyzed: de srid sngags @82b dang phyag rgyar des //
translated: for that long, the mantra and mudrā

original: gnas ni mnyam pa nyid la gnas //
analyzed: gnas ni mnyam pa nyid la gnas //
translated: abide in the state of equality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de ltar ma lus pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar ma lus pa yis //
translated: In that way, without exception,

original: bdag nyid dang ni gzhan la rang rang gi //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang ni gzhan la rang rang gi //
translated: one’s own and others’

original: lha yi gzugs gyur pa la yang dag mchod //
analyzed: lha yi gzugs gyur pa la yang dag mchod //
translated: are transformed into the form of the deity and are perfectly worshipped.

original: dam tshig de ni bde gshegs rnams kyis gnang //
analyzed: dam tshig de ni bde gshegs rnams kyis gnang //
translated: This is the pledge of the sugatas.🔽One should always be well equipoised in the actions of body and so forth,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i 'gro ba'i don rnams dang // ma lus bde gshegs mchod pa rab tu brtag / lus la sogs pa'i las rnams de dang de //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i 'gro ba'i don rnams dang // ma lus bde gshegs mchod pa rab tu brtag / lus la sogs pa'i las rnams de dang de //
translated: Which are the means of accomplishing the benefit of beings in accordance with their disposition,

original: rtag tu legs par mnyam par gzhag par bya //🔽rnam pa de dang 'dra ba'i sems ldan lus dang ni //
analyzed: rtag tu legs par mnyam par gzhag par bya // rnam pa de dang 'dra ba'i sems ldan lus dang ni //
translated: And of making offerings to the sugatas without exception.🔽The actions of body and speech of one who possesses a mind of this kind,

original: ngag gi las rnams ci yang rung ba dag //🔽phyag rgya dang ni sngags kyi rnam pa ru //
analyzed: ngag gi las rnams ci yang rung ba dag // phyag rgya dang ni sngags kyi rnam pa ru //
translated: Whatever they may be,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis de gsungs so / dngos po gcig pu la yang sna tshogs pa'i //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis de gsungs so / dngos po gcig pu la yang sna tshogs pa'i //
translated: The perfect buddhas have taught them to be the forms of mantra and mudrā.

original: kun du rtog pas bsags pa'i rnam pa las //
analyzed: kun du rtog pas bsags pa'i rnam pa las //
translated: From the accumulation of various conceptual thoughts🔽With regard to a single entity,🔽Many different kinds of actions arise,

original: sdug bsngal bde dang grol ba skyed byed pa'i //🔽las kyi khyad par mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽de bas lus sogs dge dang mi dge ba'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bde dang grol ba skyed byed pa'i // las kyi khyad par mang po 'byung bar 'gyur // de bas lus sogs dge dang mi dge ba'i //
translated: Which produce suffering, happiness, and liberation.🔽Therefore, the various powers of body and so forth,

original: rnam pa'i dbang rnams sems kyi dbang las gsungs //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbang rnams sems kyi dbang las gsungs //
translated: Which are virtuous or nonvirtuous, are said to be under the power of the mind.

original: de ltar rtog pa ma lus spangs pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa ma lus spangs pa yi //
translated: Thus, how could the mind, which has abandoned all thoughts,

original: sems ni nag po'i lus su ci phyir 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni nag po'i lus su ci phyir 'gyur //
translated: Become a black body?

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi tshogs dbyer mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje bkod pa yin te rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi tshogs dbyer mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje bkod pa yin te rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po yin no //
translated: The Vajra Array is the great Vajra Holder, because it causes the assembly of sentient beings with various inclinations to attain the samadhi of indivisibility.

original: bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni thams cad du 'di'i sdud pa pos brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni thams cad du 'di'i sdud pa pos brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase it was said is stated by the compiler here in all cases.

original: lnga par brjod pa'i dri ba dang lan bsgrub pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lnga par brjod pa'i dri ba dang lan bsgrub pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to establish the question and answer expressed in the fifth chapter, it is taught.

original: dam tshig rdo rje tog ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje tog ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba ste /
translated: The pledge vajra topknot is Sarvanivarana Viskambini.

original: de la sogs pa rnams kyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa rnams kyis smras pa'o //
translated: Those and others said.

original: ci'i slad du zhes pa ni spong ba ste 'di ma yin pa nyid de tshig 'di rnams kyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes zhe sdang gi rigs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhes pa ni spong ba ste 'di ma yin pa nyid de tshig 'di rnams kyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes zhe sdang gi rigs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Why? means rejection. By these words, the four doors of liberation—emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and natural luminosity—and the nature of phenomena, the utterly pure pristine consciousness, the nature of hatred, and so on, are explained.

original: byis pa rnams skrag par byed pa'i phyir zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams skrag par byed pa'i phyir zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that this is because it frightens fools.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum las 'das pa'o //
translated: It transcends the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: khams gsum gang yin pa nyid chos nyid de @83a * //
analyzed: khams gsum gang yin pa nyid chos nyid de @83a * //
translated: The three realms are the nature of phenomena.

original: de 'jig rten gyi khams chos nyid do zhes bya ste yang dag pa ma yin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ste de gsal bar byed pa ni ngag yin la lam ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'o //
analyzed: de 'jig rten gyi khams chos nyid do zhes bya ste yang dag pa ma yin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ste de gsal bar byed pa ni ngag yin la lam ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'o //
translated: That is the nature of the world. The unreal is the mind and mental factors in the aspect of subject and object. The path is the four doors of liberation.

original: de bsgoms pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid sgrub ste de nyid rdo rje'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bsgoms pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid sgrub ste de nyid rdo rje'i tshig go //
translated: By cultivating that, one accomplishes all the Tathāgatas themselves. That is the vajra statement.

original: ma zhes bya ba ni 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhes bya ba ni 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The word ma means to obstruct.

original: byis pa skrag par byed pa nyid kyis brjod ma thag par bstan pa ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa skrag par byed pa nyid kyis brjod ma thag par bstan pa ni dman pa'o //
translated: The inferior is what was just explained by frightening the childish.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smad pa'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smad pa'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, one should not generate the notion of contempt.

original: gang de dag bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa ci'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis gzung bar bya /
analyzed: gang de dag bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa ci'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis gzung bar bya /
translated: Why should the wise accept what was taught by those who are the Blessed Ones?

original: tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'i phyir spyod pa mchog go //
analyzed: tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'i phyir spyod pa mchog go //
translated: Because it is established by valid cognition and scripture, it is the supreme conduct.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob par byed pa'i phyir de'i spyod pa ste sngags kyi theg par bshad pa'i de ma thag par brjod pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob par byed pa'i phyir de'i spyod pa ste sngags kyi theg par bshad pa'i de ma thag par brjod pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the conduct of that, i.e., the Mantra Vehicle, which was just mentioned, because it causes the attainment of the state of a Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir 'di mkhas pa rnams kyis nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mkhas pa rnams kyis nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be ascertained by the wise.

original: tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa nyid kyis 'bras bu mchog thob par byed pas na mchog go //
analyzed: tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa nyid kyis 'bras bu mchog thob par byed pas na mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it causes the attainment of the highest fruit by means of valid cognition and scripture.

original: ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyod pa 'dir khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul gyi dpe gsungs pa 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyod pa 'dir khyab pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul gyi dpe gsungs pa 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The example of the object which proves the pervasion of this conduct of the nature of non-arising is stated here: “For example, space pervades the ten directions.”

original: nam mkha' ni phyogs bcu thams cad du son pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni phyogs bcu thams cad du son pa'o //
translated: Space is present in all ten directions.

original: der yang phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: der yang phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, i.e., in space, the aggregates, etc.,

original: de'i rang bzhin rnams nyid ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams te de'i phyir de rnams su ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rnams nyid ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams te de'i phyir de rnams su ma yin no //
translated: are the four great elements, i.e., the earth element, etc., which are of the nature of space. Therefore, they are not other than that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams nam mkha'i rjes su song ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams nam mkha'i rjes su song ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are in accord with space.

original: ji ltar yang 'di rnams bzhin du ma skyes pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song bar rigs lnga'i bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad do zhes gsungs pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'di rnams bzhin du ma skyes pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song bar rigs lnga'i bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad do zhes gsungs pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as they are, so are all phenomena, which have the nature of the five families, in accord with reality, which is the nature of non-arising.🔽This is what is said in the passage beginning with the words, “Just as space is not a thing, nor a non-thing…”

original: don gyi dbang 'di gzigs zhes pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi dbang 'di gzigs zhes pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la rag las pa'o //
translated: “Seeing this import” means that it depends on the import of reality.

original: bsam pa mkhyen nas zhes pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos rtogs pa la snod nyid du shin tu dag pa mi g-yo bar ro //
analyzed: bsam pa mkhyen nas zhes pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos rtogs pa la snod nyid du shin tu dag pa mi g-yo bar ro //
translated: “Having understood their thoughts” means that they are vessels for the realization of the Dharma in this way, and they are purified and unshakable.

original: gang dang gang las zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs kyis sems can gyi don mthong na de dang de nyid kyi dbang du byas te bden pa gnyis la brten nas chos ston pa rnams la thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dang gang las zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs kyis sems can gyi don mthong na de dang de nyid kyi dbang du byas te bden pa gnyis la brten nas chos ston pa rnams la thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The Sugatas, whose nature is great compassion, see the benefit for sentient beings in this and that, and they teach the Dharma in accordance with that and that, based on the two truths.

original: @83b thams cad la skabs 'byed pas dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes nam mkha' ste 'di spangs pa'i dpe ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @83b thams cad la skabs 'byed pas dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes nam mkha' ste 'di spangs pa'i dpe ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is the occasion for everything, the wisdom that is not an object is space. There is no example for this, since it is not abandoned.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' yin pa de ltar sangs rgyas yin la sems can yang 'di'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes rigs pa las so //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' yin pa de ltar sangs rgyas yin la sems can yang 'di'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes rigs pa las so //
translated: Just as it is space, so it is buddhahood, and this is the characteristic of sentient beings.

original: des na brjod ma thag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams dam tshig kyang yin pa nyid du rjes su rtogs pa nyid du bya ste de kho na nyid du'o //
analyzed: des na brjod ma thag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams dam tshig kyang yin pa nyid du rjes su rtogs pa nyid du bya ste de kho na nyid du'o //
translated: Thus, one should realize that the aforementioned tathāgatas are also the commitments, in reality.

original: des na 'di ston pa la dman pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ston pa la dman pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not generate the perception of inferiority, etc., toward this teacher.

original: ji ltar na yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa bskyed par spang ba sba bar mi nus pa gal te de kho na nyid du chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid yin na skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar na yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa bskyed par spang ba sba bar mi nus pa gal te de kho na nyid du chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid yin na skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: How is it that the generation of Vajra Body, etc., cannot be rejected as a deprecation, if all phenomena are really non-arisen?

original: gzugs su rung bas gzugs dang myong bas na tshor ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pas 'du shes dang ji srid du sems g-yo bar byed pas 'du byed dang so sor shes pas rnam par shes pa ste mtshan nyid 'di rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes brjod par bya ste so sor snang ba tsam la
analyzed: gzugs su rung bas gzugs dang myong bas na tshor ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pas 'du shes dang ji srid du sems g-yo bar byed pas 'du byed dang so sor shes pas rnam par shes pa ste mtshan nyid 'di rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes brjod par bya ste so sor snang ba tsam la
translated: Since they are empty of these characteristics, it should be said that all phenomena are empty.🔽The reason is stated: “Because they are mere individual appearances.”

original: skur ba 'debs pa ma yin pa'i rigs pas 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor snang ba tsam sba bar mi nus par gsungs so //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa ma yin pa'i rigs pas 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor snang ba tsam sba bar mi nus par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that mere individual appearances of dependent origination cannot be denied.

original: de bzhin du zhes te gus pa dang bcas pa yun ring por bar ma chad par bsgoms pa med na mthar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang de rnams kyi rdo rje'i dam tshig kyang mngon sum du mi 'gyur te de las gzhan du gang du yang mi
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes te gus pa dang bcas pa yun ring por bar ma chad par bsgoms pa med na mthar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang de rnams kyi rdo rje'i dam tshig kyang mngon sum du mi 'gyur te de las gzhan du gang du yang mi
translated: Similarly, if one does not meditate with devotion for a long time without interruption, in the end one will not even perceive all the Tathāgatas and their vajra commitments.

original: 'gro'o // de nyid yod pa na gsal por rtag tu mngon sum du 'gyur te gzhan gang las kyang 'ong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro'o // de nyid yod pa na gsal por rtag tu mngon sum du 'gyur te gzhan gang las kyang 'ong ba ma yin no //
translated: When it exists, it is always clearly manifest, and it does not come from anywhere else.

original: gang du yang gnas pa ma yin te sogs pa'i sgra'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du yang gnas pa ma yin te sogs pa'i sgra'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not abide anywhere, because of the word “etc.”

original: gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ro gcig pas de rnams dang de'i yang rtag tu thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong bar gnas pa rnams kyang ji ltar brtags pa yin te de kho na nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ro gcig pas de rnams dang de'i yang rtag tu thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong bar gnas pa rnams kyang ji ltar brtags pa yin te de kho na nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is of one taste, nondual suchness, it is always everywhere, so how can going, coming, and abiding be imagined? It is impossible in reality.

original: chos 'di shin tu zab pa nyid du tshad mas grub par bstan pa'i don dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyan pa po'i skye bo yang dag par slob pa'i don du yang dga' ba dang bcas pas chos kyi dbyings gsungs so //
analyzed: chos 'di shin tu zab pa nyid du tshad mas grub par bstan pa'i don dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyan pa po'i skye bo yang dag par slob pa'i don du yang dga' ba dang bcas pas chos kyi dbyings gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the statement that this Dharma is extremely profound is established by valid cognition. The dharmadhātu is also stated with delight for the sake of future generations of listeners who are to be trained.

original: rmad du byung ba chen po ci zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i de @84a * //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba chen po ci zhe na / gang gi phyir nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i de @84a * //
translated: What is the great wonder?

original: bzhin nyid gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: bzhin nyid gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: It is the suchness that is equal to space.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: the elements of water, gold, and space

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be pure like the pure.

original: ces pa'i rigs pas dag pa yin la mi rtog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ces pa'i rigs pas dag pa yin la mi rtog pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, it is pure and also non-conceptual.

original: de ltar na bstan pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa kun rdzob tu yang bshad pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa kun rdzob tu yang bshad pa yin no zhes so //
translated: Thus, the statement “it would follow that there would be no teaching” is explained as being in terms of the conventional.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te bstan pa la sogs pa'i tha snyang ni dngos po la yod pa la yin te 'on kyang spyir sgro btags pas kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te bstan pa la sogs pa'i tha snyang ni dngos po la yod pa la yin te 'on kyang spyir sgro btags pas kun rdzob bo //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The conventional terms “teaching” and so on exist in relation to things, but in general they are the conventional because they are superimpositions.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said,

original: 'jam dpal bstan du med pa ste //
analyzed: 'jam dpal bstan du med pa ste //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is not taught.

original: bstan pa ni btags su yod pas so //
analyzed: bstan pa ni btags su yod pas so //
translated: Teaching is imputedly existent.

original: sgra dang rnam par rtog pa yang brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel te mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dang rnam par rtog pa yang brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel te mi slu ba'o //
translated: Sound and conception are also indirectly related to things and are nondeceptive.

original: med na ni slu ba'o //
analyzed: med na ni slu ba'o //
translated: If they did not exist, they would be deceptive.

original: tha dad dngos rnams la brten nas //
analyzed: tha dad dngos rnams la brten nas //
translated: Based on different things,

original: don gcig tu ni snang ba'i blo //🔽gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: don gcig tu ni snang ba'i blo // gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: the mind appears as a single object.🔽That which obscures

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib byed pa //
translated: the nature of other things with its own nature

original: kun rdzob des bdag tha dad kyang //
analyzed: kun rdzob des bdag tha dad kyang //
translated: By that convention, although the self is different,

original: tha dad nyid bsgribs pa yin //🔽dngos rnams ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: tha dad nyid bsgribs pa yin // dngos rnams ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: It is as if it were not different.🔽Things appear as if they were

original: tha dad min pa lta bur snang //
analyzed: tha dad min pa lta bur snang //
translated: Not different by way of some nature.

original: de la bsam pa'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i dbang gis na //
translated: In that regard, due to the power of thought,

original: spyi yod pa ni rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: spyi yod pa ni rab tu bsgrags //
translated: The existence of universals is proclaimed.

original: de yis ji ltar kun brtags pa //
analyzed: de yis ji ltar kun brtags pa //
translated: Whatever is imagined by that

original: de ni dam pa'i don du med //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i don du med //
translated: Does not exist in an ultimate sense.

original: shes pa yod pa'i don de rnams //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa'i don de rnams //
translated: Those objects that exist as consciousness

original: 'di ltar ldog pa'i ngo bo can //🔽des na tha dad min lta bu //🔽de la'ang gzhan las ldog par yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar ldog pa'i ngo bo can // des na tha dad min lta bu // de la'ang gzhan las ldog par yang //
translated: Are like that in having the nature of exclusions.🔽Therefore, they appear as if they were not different.

original: snang ste de la spyi dang ni //
analyzed: snang ste de la spyi dang ni //
translated: Even in that regard, they appear as the exclusion of other.🔽In that regard, those who engage with universals

original: gzhi mthun spyod yul can dag gis //🔽shes pa dang ni brjod pa yis //
analyzed: gzhi mthun spyod yul can dag gis // shes pa dang ni brjod pa yis //
translated: And those who engage with common loci🔽Expand the conventional meaning of cognition

original: tha snyad nor don can rgyas byed //
analyzed: tha snyad nor don can rgyas byed //
translated: And expression.

original: dngos po rnams kyi de kun yang //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi de kun yang //
translated: All of those of things

original: phan tshun med la brten pa ste //
analyzed: phan tshun med la brten pa ste //
translated: Are mutually dependent and not independent.

original: des na gzhan sel yul can yin //
analyzed: des na gzhan sel yul can yin //
translated: Therefore, they are the domain of other-exclusion.

original: gang la dngos dang 'brel yod pa //
analyzed: gang la dngos dang 'brel yod pa //
translated: Whatever is related to an entity

original: dngos po rnyed pa'i rten yin te //
analyzed: dngos po rnyed pa'i rten yin te //
translated: Is the basis for the attainment of an entity.

original: rjes dpag ji skad bshad ji bzhin //
analyzed: rjes dpag ji skad bshad ji bzhin //
translated: Inference is as explained.

original: 'khrul par 'dra yang gzhan la min //
analyzed: 'khrul par 'dra yang gzhan la min //
translated: Though similar to error, it is not so for others.

original: mar me'i 'od la nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od la nor bu bzhin //
translated: Like the light of a lamp for a gem.

original: zhes rnam 'grel las so //
analyzed: zhes rnam 'grel las so //
translated: Thus it is in the Thorough Exposition.🔽The ultimate is held to be threefold:

original: don dang thob dang bsgrub pa dang // dam pa'i don ni gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: don dang thob dang bsgrub pa dang // dam pa'i don ni gsum du 'dod //
translated: object, attainment, and practice.

original: ces te des na ma bcos pa'i dag pa yang yin te nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: ces te des na ma bcos pa'i dag pa yang yin te nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de rigs lnga'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also unfabricated purity, because it is free from afflictive and knowledge obscurations along with their traces. That reality is the five families.

original: don ni dgos pa ste yul yang yin la rang gi don du'o //
analyzed: don ni dgos pa ste yul yang yin la rang gi don du'o //
translated: Object means purpose, and also object, for one's own sake.

original: brjod par bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du yin te gang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du yin te gang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The subject matter is for the sake of others, that of Akshobhya and so forth.

original: de rnams kyang @84b dam tshig yin te sngar brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang @84b dam tshig yin te sngar brjod pa rnams so //
translated: Those are also commitments, as previously mentioned.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i snying rje dang shes rab dang nyi ma so so'i thun mtshams bzhir ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang so so'i bkas gcig tu gzhan gyi don du nges pa la sogs pa yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i snying rje dang shes rab dang nyi ma so so'i thun mtshams bzhir ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang so so'i bkas gcig tu gzhan gyi don du nges pa la sogs pa yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor
translated: In this way, with compassion, wisdom, and the three samadhis at the four periods of the day, one should practice the yoga of the Tathagata's word and the individual words, and so forth, for the sake of others.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba rnams ji ltar brjod pa'i rjes su gnang ba'i yul las gzhan du zhugs pa la yang mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba rnams ji ltar brjod pa'i rjes su gnang ba'i yul las gzhan du zhugs pa la yang mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the perfect yogi are incomplete. How can one engage in the ten non-virtues and so forth, which are objects other than what is permitted by the teachings?

original: gang gi phyir lung phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin te yul tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin te yul tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the scriptures are not contradictory, they have different objects.

original: bud med gdong ni yang dang yang mi blta //
analyzed: bud med gdong ni yang dang yang mi blta //
translated: One should not look at a woman's face again and again.

original: bud med du ga la nam yang reg mi bya //
analyzed: bud med du ga la nam yang reg mi bya //
translated: How can one ever touch a woman?

original: chu dang me yis de tshe 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chu dang me yis de tshe 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: At that time, one should die by water or fire.

original: de yis sa yi 'du shes bskyed de reg //
analyzed: de yis sa yi 'du shes bskyed de reg //
translated: One should generate the perception of earth and touch.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag bzhin du sngar brjod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag bzhin du sngar brjod do //
translated: Thus it is said, and so forth, as stated before.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u ste dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter of the Ornament of the Glorious Guhyasamaja, called “The Mandala.”

original: // / de nas zhes te rigs lnga rnams ni dgod par bya /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes te rigs lnga rnams ni dgod par bya /
translated: Then, the five clans are to be arrayed.

original: zhes brjod pa de de ru ci dang por brjod pa'i rigs lnga rnams yin nam gzhan du de rnams kyi sa bon yin /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de de ru ci dang por brjod pa'i rigs lnga rnams yin nam gzhan du de rnams kyi sa bon yin /
translated: What is said there? Are the five clans mentioned first or are they the seeds of those?

original: ci'i phyir de rnams dgod /🔽gang gi tshe yang nyin dang mtshan du ma tshang ba med pa'i ting nges 'dzin dang dam tshig dang sdom pa la sogs pa'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa lhas rjes su gnang ba shes rab dang ldan pa dad pa dang yang dag par ldan pas zla
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnams dgod / gang gi tshe yang nyin dang mtshan du ma tshang ba med pa'i ting nges 'dzin dang dam tshig dang sdom pa la sogs pa'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa lhas rjes su gnang ba shes rab dang ldan pa dad pa dang yang dag par ldan pas zla
translated: Why are they arrayed?

original: ba drug gam gsum mam gnyis sam phyed dang gnyis sam gcig gam phyed du bsgrubs la /
analyzed: ba drug gam gsum mam gnyis sam phyed dang gnyis sam gcig gam phyed du bsgrubs la /
translated: When the yogi/ni who is abiding in the path of samadhi, pledge, vow, and so forth, without deficiency day and night, has been granted permission by the deity, and is endowed with wisdom and endowed with faith, he/she should practice for six, three, two, one and a half, one, or half a month.

original: drug gis lha rnams ma grub pa de'i tshe bdun pa la bsgrub pas ci brtsam par bya ba yin nam zhes gdul bya'i 'dod pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: drug gis lha rnams ma grub pa de'i tshe bdun pa la bsgrub pas ci brtsam par bya ba yin nam zhes gdul bya'i 'dod pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: If the deities are not accomplished in six months, then what should be done in the seventh month?

original: dam tshig chen po'i rdo rje ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i rdo rje ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The great commitment vajra is Vajrasattva, who is without beginning or end.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni zag pa med pa rgyun du 'byung ba yin la bde ba dang yid bde ba dang kun du bzang po yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni zag pa med pa rgyun du 'byung ba yin la bde ba dang yid bde ba dang kun du bzang po yang yin no //
translated: His reality is the uncontaminated, which is always present, and is bliss, mental pleasure, and universal goodness.

original: de mngon par byang chub pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon par byang chub pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: His enlightenment is his manifestation.

original: de nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsung ba gang gi yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsung ba gang gi yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is the one who speaks with the body, speech, and mind of that reality, and is so called.

original: de nyid rigs ni lnga ru brjod //
analyzed: de nyid rigs ni lnga ru brjod //
translated: That reality is said to be the five families.

original: ces rgyud phyi ma las te de'i bdag nyid kyi h'um aom sv'a a'a:h'a zhes pa'i yi ge lnga po ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: ces rgyud phyi ma las te de'i bdag nyid kyi h'um aom sv'a a'a:h'a zhes pa'i yi ge lnga po ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: In the Later Tantra, the five syllables of his nature, hum, om, svā, ha, and kṣa, are reality.

original: de nyid ni thams cad kyi sngags rnams 'dir 'dus @85a * //
analyzed: de nyid ni thams cad kyi sngags rnams 'dir 'dus @85a * //
translated: That reality is the essence and the collection of all mantras here, because they are included in it.

original: pa'i phyir snying po yang yin la 'dus pa yang yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir snying po yang yin la 'dus pa yang yin no //
translated: It is the essence and the collection.

original: de nyid dam tshig dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rigs dag zhe sdang gi rigs kyi nang du 'dus pas rigs gsum gyi gsang bar brjod do zhes pas sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang bar grags /
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rigs dag zhe sdang gi rigs kyi nang du 'dus pas rigs gsum gyi gsang bar brjod do zhes pas sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang bar grags /
translated: Since the families of the commitments and the wish-fulfilling gem are pure and included within the family of wrath, they are called the secret of the three families.

original: 'di chen po yang yin la phyogs bcu mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su snang ba'i so so'i rdul phra rab shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin dri ma med pa bde ba chen po'i rnam par rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te
analyzed: 'di chen po yang yin la phyogs bcu mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su snang ba'i so so'i rdul phra rab shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin dri ma med pa bde ba chen po'i rnam par rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te
translated: This is the great seal, since it is the great seal of the five families, which is the nature of the wisdom and method of the individual atoms of light that appear in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, which are the essence of the mandalas of the five families in the aspect of great bliss, which is stainless.

original: dngos grub kyang yin la /
analyzed: dngos grub kyang yin la /
translated: It is also the attainment,

original: 'di de'i tshul yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di de'i tshul yang yin te /
translated: and it is the method of that.

original: de las khyad par can med pas mchog kyang yin no //
analyzed: de las khyad par can med pas mchog kyang yin no //
translated: Since there is nothing superior to that, it is also supreme.

original: nyon mongs kun gyi rgya mtsho ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun gyi rgya mtsho ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: The ocean of all afflictions is samsara.

original: de'i mnga' bdag ni ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mnga' bdag ni ston pa yin te /
translated: The lord of that is the teacher.

original: nyon mongs pa 'chos pas 'khor ba dang zhi ba mnyam zhing ro gcig pa'i ye shes la sems can gyi khams rab tu 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'chos pas 'khor ba dang zhi ba mnyam zhing ro gcig pa'i ye shes la sems can gyi khams rab tu 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the transformation of the afflictions, he establishes the realm of sentient beings in the wisdom of the equality and sameness of samsara and nirvana.

original: 'bar ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsregs pas so //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsregs pas so //
translated: Blazing means that he burns the fuel of the afflictions.

original: drag po ni snying rje'i rang bzhin gyi khro bo yin pas so //
analyzed: drag po ni snying rje'i rang bzhin gyi khro bo yin pas so //
translated: Fierce means that he is wrathful by nature compassionate.

original: de kho na nyid bstan pa'i don du de bsgom pa'i ngo bor re zhig pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bstan pa'i don du de bsgom pa'i ngo bor re zhig pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach reality, he first speaks of the nature of its cultivation:

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams ni so sor sku gsung thugs bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams ni so sor sku gsung thugs bsgom pa'o //
translated: The vajras of body, speech, and mind are the cultivations of body, speech, and mind.

original: mnyam pa ni de bzhin nyid de gang du skye ba med pa dang 'gag med pa 'di ni mnyam pa nyid ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni de bzhin nyid de gang du skye ba med pa dang 'gag med pa 'di ni mnyam pa nyid ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Equality is suchness, because it is said that this nonarising and noncessation is equality.

original: de'i ngo bo gang la yang mi gnas pa ni zhen pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te de nyid kyi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo gang la yang mi gnas pa ni zhen pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te de nyid kyi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The nonabiding in any nature is because of the nonapprehension of attachment, and for that very reason it is nonconceptual.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin gnyis med //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin gnyis med //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nondual.

original: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: That wisdom is the Tathagata.

original: ces pa'i rigs pas rdo rje ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams yin te gang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu 'am drug po nyid sngags yin la /
analyzed: ces pa'i rigs pas rdo rje ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams yin te gang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu 'am drug po nyid sngags yin la /
translated: The reasoning of this verse is that the vajra is the perfections and so forth, which are the mantras that are the ten or six perfections themselves.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams yin te /
translated: The Sugatas are the nature of wisdom and compassion.

original: de ston par byed pa yi ge h'um la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa yi ge h'um la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The letters such as hūṃ are that which teaches them.

original: de rnams kyi tshul yang rdo rje'o sems can gyi don byed pa'i rol mo ni sna tshogs pa'i spyod lam dang kha dog dang cha byad dang nyams la sogs pa rnams kyis mtshon pa'o //🔽phyogs bcu 'jig rten gyi khams mthas klas pa rnams su zhes pa ni snod dang ldan pa'i skye bo la ltos pas yin te mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi @85b //
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshul yang rdo rje'o sems can gyi don byed pa'i rol mo ni sna tshogs pa'i spyod lam dang kha dog dang cha byad dang nyams la sogs pa rnams kyis mtshon pa'o // phyogs bcu 'jig rten gyi khams mthas klas pa rnams su zhes pa ni snod dang ldan pa'i skye bo la ltos pas yin te mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi @85b //
translated: The way of those is the vajra. The play that benefits sentient beings is indicated by the various modes of conduct, colors, costumes, moods, and so on.

original: khams zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in the world systems of the ten directions as far as the limits of space” is in terms of those who are suitable vessels, because it is said that the world systems are limitless.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rol ba bstan pa gsungs pha rol pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rol ba bstan pa gsungs pha rol pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the play of the body and so on is stated by “the play of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas,” and so forth.

translated: The teachings are the Sutra, the Song, the Prophesy, the Stanza, the Expression, the Precept, the Narration, the Parable, the Story, the Birth, the Expanded, the Marvel, the Statement of Meaning, and the Clarification.

analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid rnams ni lam ste bgrod pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir de brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: de lta bu byung ba'i sde ni sngar byung ba brjod pa'o //

analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs ston pa'o //

analyzed: gleng gzhi dang rtogs pa brjod pa dang gtan la phab pa zhes pa'i yan lag gsum ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa rnams su 'dus pas gsung rab yan lag dgu'o //
translated: The three branches called Nidana, Avadana, and Upadega are included in the Sutra and so forth, so the scriptures are nine branches.

original: nges pa nyid du 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskul bas sngags bsgom pa la mngon par brtson pa bstan pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du 'di mthu gsungs pa /
analyzed: nges pa nyid du 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskul bas sngags bsgom pa la mngon par brtson pa bstan pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du 'di mthu gsungs pa /
translated: In order to generate the teaching of the one who strives in the mantra meditation by the Tathagatas' urging, he says this, which is the power:

original: 'dar zhing zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dar zhing zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Trembling and so forth.

original: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dran pas 'jigs pa chen po la sogs pa med do zhes yang dag par bslab pa'i don du yang rdo rje sems dpa' rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dran pas 'jigs pa chen po la sogs pa med do zhes yang dag par bslab pa'i don du yang rdo rje sems dpa' rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In order to train in the meaning of there is no great fear, etc. by remembering one's chosen deity, one should be endowed with the recollection of Vajrasattva.

original: le'u dang por rgyur gyur pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa grub pa gsungs la da ni 'bras bur gyur pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: le'u dang por rgyur gyur pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa grub pa gsungs la da ni 'bras bur gyur pa gsungs pa /
translated: In the first chapter, the cause-Vajradhara was taught; now, the result-Vajradhara is taught.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Then and so forth.

original: de rdzogs pa nyid ni 'dir dam tshig go //
analyzed: de rdzogs pa nyid ni 'dir dam tshig go //
translated: Its perfection is the pledge here.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis phyogs bcu thams cad du khyab pa'i 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor te gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis phyogs bcu thams cad du khyab pa'i 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor te gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: The wheel of the mass of light rays of all the Tathagatas pervading all ten directions is the mandala, the celestial mansion.

original: thub dbang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor tshogs pa'i //🔽zer gyis phyogs mtshams ma lus kun khyab pa //
analyzed: thub dbang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor tshogs pa'i // zer gyis phyogs mtshams ma lus kun khyab pa //
translated: The light-mandala of the Lord of Sages

original: zhes brjod pas so //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas so //
translated: pervades all directions and intermediate directions without exception.

original: yi ge h'um ni zla ba zhu ba yongs su gyur pa las so //
analyzed: yi ge h'um ni zla ba zhu ba yongs su gyur pa las so //
translated: The syllable hum is from the transformation of the melted moon.

original: yi ge h'um rang gi gzugs ni rtse mo lnga gnyis can gyi rdo rje dmar po'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um rang gi gzugs ni rtse mo lnga gnyis can gyi rdo rje dmar po'o //
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is the form of a red vajra with two five-pointed tips.

original: des na de'i rnam pa ru brtag par bya ste bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de'i rnam pa ru brtag par bya ste bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should imagine, should meditate, in that form.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni phyogs bcu na gnas pa rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs phrogs pa ni bkug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni phyogs bcu na gnas pa rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs phrogs pa ni bkug pa'o //
translated: The bodies, speech, and minds of the Buddhas who dwell in the ten directions are summoned,

original: de nyid ni rdo rje lte bar gnas pa'i yi ge h'um gis so //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje lte bar gnas pa'i yi ge h'um gis so //
translated: and they are placed in the center of the vajra by the syllable HŪṀ.

original: rnal 'byor pa des skad cig de nyid la rdo rje yongs su gyur @87b pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des skad cig de nyid la rdo rje yongs su gyur @87b pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: The yogi/nī, immediately after the transformation of the vajra,

original: rang gi 'khor lo ni rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'khor lo ni rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: in his/her own mandala,

original: rang gi sngags kyis zhes pa ni sa bon gyis te yi ge h'um la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyis zhes pa ni sa bon gyis te yi ge h'um la sogs pas so //
translated: with his/her own mantra, with the seed, with the syllable HŪṀ, etc.🔽,

original: gang gsungs pa /🔽rang gi snying po las byung ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa / rang gi snying po las byung ma lus pa'i //
translated: as it is said:🔽Having imagined the forms of all the innate mandala-beings

original: gnyug ma'i dkyil 'khor ba yi gzugs bsams te //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i dkyil 'khor ba yi gzugs bsams te //
translated: arisen from one's essence,

original: zhes so // skabs su bab pa'i bdun pa drag shul gyi sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // skabs su bab pa'i bdun pa drag shul gyi sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of wrath is taught in the present context.

original: rang sngags skyes bu ni rang gi lha nyid dbus su bsgoms nas rang gi sngags las de'i gzugs rnams phyung ste phyogs bzhi ru yang dag par bzhag ste /
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bu ni rang gi lha nyid dbus su bsgoms nas rang gi sngags las de'i gzugs rnams phyung ste phyogs bzhi ru yang dag par bzhag ste /
translated: The person born from one's mantra is one's deity itself, visualized in the center, and the forms of that deity are emanated from one's mantra and perfectly placed in the four directions.

original: de rnams kyi snying ga'i dbus su son pa'i phra mo'i dkyil 'khor rnams bsgom par bya'o ;
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying ga'i dbus su son pa'i phra mo'i dkyil 'khor rnams bsgom par bya'o ;
translated: One should visualize the subtle maṇḍala in the center of their hearts.

original: / rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa de'i rang gi bdag po'i snying ga la gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i zla ba'i dbus su son pa'i mi 'gyur ba'i yi ge h'um de ni rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje chen po'o //
analyzed: / rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa de'i rang gi bdag po'i snying ga la gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i zla ba'i dbus su son pa'i mi 'gyur ba'i yi ge h'um de ni rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje chen po'o //
translated: The unchanging syllable hūṃ, which is in the center of the moon in the heart of the gnosis being who resides in the heart of one's master of the maṇḍala, is the great five-pronged vajra.

original: sbyor bas zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bas zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: By union is the union of method and wisdom.

original: rtag tu ni thun bzhi ru bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni thun bzhi ru bsgom pa'o //
translated: Always is to meditate in four sessions.

original: rdo rje gsum rnams ni thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma'i lcags kyu rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum rnams ni thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma'i lcags kyu rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: Since the three vajras are the nature of the mind vajra and so on, one should use the vajra, wheel, and lotus hooks.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rdo rje lcags kyus dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyus dbye ba yis //
translated: By the vajra hook, the separation.

original: zhes so // des na rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i gnas ji lta bar brdeg par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes so // des na rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i gnas ji lta bar brdeg par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, by the vajra hook, etc., one should strike the abode of Cittavajra, etc., just as it is.

original: rab tu bskul ba ni dngos grub ster ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bskul ba ni dngos grub ster ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The intense urging is the facing of the bestowal of the powers.

original: rdo rje thams cad kyi sngags kyi spyod pa la mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad kyi sngags kyi spyod pa la mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is for those who are intent on the mantra practice of all vajras.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi aom la sogs pa las byung ba'i rang gi mtshan ma las skyes pa'i lcags kyu gsum gyis bskul bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi aom la sogs pa las byung ba'i rang gi mtshan ma las skyes pa'i lcags kyu gsum gyis bskul bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, those who belong to the wheel clan, etc., should be urged by the three hooks born from their own seed, which is the syllable Om, etc. This is stated by the verse beginning with “wheel,” etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kar brgyab pas rnal 'byor pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kar brgyab pas rnal 'byor pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one strikes the heart of the Tathagata, there will be an offense for the yogi.

original: gsungs pa brdeg pa 'di rang gi sems kyi snang ba'i rol mo las kun rdzob tu byung ba yin la de kho na nyid du brdeg par bya ba dang rdeg par byed pa dang brdeg pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa de'i
analyzed: gsungs pa brdeg pa 'di rang gi sems kyi snang ba'i rol mo las kun rdzob tu byung ba yin la de kho na nyid du brdeg par bya ba dang rdeg par byed pa dang brdeg pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa de'i
translated: The one who is beaten is a display of the appearance of one’s own mind, which arises conventionally. In reality, the one who is beaten, the one who does the beating, and the beating do not exist.

original: tshe shes par bya ste 'di ltar thugs rje chen pos gzhan gyi don du 'jug pas ci'i phyir rnal 'byor pa la kha na ma tho ba'i go skabs yod /
analyzed: tshe shes par bya ste 'di ltar thugs rje chen pos gzhan gyi don du 'jug pas ci'i phyir rnal 'byor pa la kha na ma tho ba'i go skabs yod /
translated: Therefore, at that time, one should understand the unmistaken nature of things. Thus, since the great compassionate one engages for the benefit of others, why would there be an opportunity for the yogin to have a misdeed?

original: @88a * // 'di ni thugs bskul ba drag shul gyi sgrub thabs bdun pa'o //
analyzed: @88a * // 'di ni thugs bskul ba drag shul gyi sgrub thabs bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh sādhana, the fierce urging of the mind.

original: 'jigs pa ni rang gis dam bcas pa las 'das pa la 'jigs pa yin te mi 'jigs pa thob pa nyid kyis 'jigs pa gzhan mi srid pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni rang gis dam bcas pa las 'das pa la 'jigs pa yin te mi 'jigs pa thob pa nyid kyis 'jigs pa gzhan mi srid pas so //
translated: Fear is the fear of transgressing one’s promise. Since one has attained fearlessness, other fears are impossible.

original: sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' sngags kyi spyod pa'i mchog la spyod pa ji skad du brjod pa'i tshul gyis bskul ba yod na yang gal te ma grub na dam tshig las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' sngags kyi spyod pa'i mchog la spyod pa ji skad du brjod pa'i tshul gyis bskul ba yod na yang gal te ma grub na dam tshig las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: If, even though the Buddha or the Bodhisattva who is practicing the supreme conduct of mantra is invoked in the manner described, he does not succeed, he will transgress his vow.

original: gti mug gi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa can no //
analyzed: gti mug gi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa can no //
translated: He is of the nature of delusion, and his consciousness is free of conceptualization.

original: de'i de zhes pa ni shin tu 'das pa de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i de zhes pa ni shin tu 'das pa de'i'o //
translated: His that is, of the Buddha.

original: srog ces pa 'dis ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: srog ces pa 'dis ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa 'di yin no //
translated: Life this is not to be transgressed.

original: sbyor ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems brtan par byas pa dang ldan pa ste de dag la nye bar gnas na 'chi ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems brtan par byas pa dang ldan pa ste de dag la nye bar gnas na 'chi ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Union this is endowed with the firm mind of the yogin, and when he abides in them, death is impossible.

original: sgrub pa pos kyang gal te ji ltar brjod pa'i go rims ji lta bar ma zhugs na mdor na 'bras bu mthong bas drag po'i sgrub pa brtsam par bya ste de'i tshe de yang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos kyang gal te ji ltar brjod pa'i go rims ji lta bar ma zhugs na mdor na 'bras bu mthong bas drag po'i sgrub pa brtsam par bya ste de'i tshe de yang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The adept also, if he does not enter in the manner and order described, should, in short, commence the fierce rite of attainment by seeing the result, and at that time he will be destroyed.

original: ji srid du sngags rnams kyang yin te de rnams shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skyes bu yang yin te skyes bu chen po'i mtshan la sogs pa sbyor ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: ji srid du sngags rnams kyang yin te de rnams shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skyes bu yang yin te skyes bu chen po'i mtshan la sogs pa sbyor ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: As long as they are mantras, they are the nature of wisdom and compassion, and they are also persons, because they are endowed with the application of the marks of a great being and so forth.

original: gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i ye shes kyis gang ba mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de srid pa'o //
analyzed: gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i ye shes kyis gang ba mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de srid pa'o //
translated: The three are Akṣhobhya and so forth, who are filled with the gnosis of the body and so forth.

original: dngos po thams cad bsgom pa ni phung po la sogs pa rnams te so so'i rdul phra rab dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par 'jug pas bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bsgom pa ni phung po la sogs pa rnams te so so'i rdul phra rab dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par 'jug pas bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pas brtag par bya'o //
translated: The meditation on all things is the aggregates and so forth, which are to be imagined by the method of great bliss with the various aspects through the meditative concentration of wisdom and method, the application of the two organs to the individual subtle particles.

original: gang gi phyir de'i sngags 'di grub pa'i don du dam tshig ste de kho na nyid bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i sngags 'di grub pa'i don du dam tshig ste de kho na nyid bsgom pa'o //
translated: Because of that, this mantra is the meditation on reality, the pledge for the sake of accomplishing the goal.

original: rig ma ni rang 'od kyi shes rab yin la nyid dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: rig ma ni rang 'od kyi shes rab yin la nyid dbang phyug ste /
translated: The knowledge woman is one’s own light, the wisdom, and the lord is oneself,

original: dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of pervading all things.

original: de la zhugs pa rnams la rdo rjes padma la sbyor ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa rnams la rdo rjes padma la sbyor ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: For those who have entered that, one should cultivate the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: de yang chags la ste chags pa chen pos chags pa'i lta ba yang bsgom par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chags la ste chags pa chen pos chags pa'i lta ba yang bsgom par mi bya'o //
translated: And that is not to be cultivated with passion, with great passion, or with a view of passion.

original: gang gi phyir dam tshig gi de kho na nyid de nyid kyi ma yin te snying po yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam tshig gi de kho na nyid de nyid kyi ma yin te snying po yin no //
translated: Because that is the reality of the commitment, and that itself is the essence.

original: de len par byed pas dkyil 'khor te 'di ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de len par byed pas dkyil 'khor te 'di ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: The mandala is that which takes it up, and this is the cultivation.

original: khyab pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyab pa gsungs pa /
translated: The pervasion is stated:

original: 'jig rten khams ni thams cad na //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni thams cad na //
translated: In all the world systems,

original: bud med ji snyed yod gyur pa //
analyzed: bud med ji snyed yod gyur pa //
translated: however many women there are,

original: de dag thams cad rang 'od kyi rig ma la @88b yid kyis spyan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rang 'od kyi rig ma la @88b yid kyis spyan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gzhug par bya'o //
translated: all of them should be mentally introduced by the practitioner in the form of Locanā, etc., into one’s own light consort.

original: phyag rgya chen po yid las byung //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yid las byung //
translated: The great seal is mental.

original: dam tshig phyag rgya kun du son //
analyzed: dam tshig phyag rgya kun du son //
translated: The commitment seal is omnipresent.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya tshig yin te //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya tshig yin te //
translated: The doctrine seal is verbal.

original: las kyi phyag rgya lus las byung //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya lus las byung //
translated: The action seal arises from the body.

original: zhes te / phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i sbyor bas bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes te / phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i sbyor bas bsten par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should rely on the great seal, etc., by means of the practice.

original: bsten pa'i dus der yang rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phyogs bcu rnams su spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsten pa'i dus der yang rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phyogs bcu rnams su spro bar bya ste /
translated: At the time of reliance, one should emanate the Tathagatas into the ten directions from the pores of one's body.

original: sems can ma lus pa'i don ji lta bu'i las byas nas slar yang bsdu ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa'i don ji lta bu'i las byas nas slar yang bsdu ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Having performed the deeds for the sake of all sentient beings, one should again gather them in, and so forth.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: The tenth chapter of the Sri-Guhyasamaja-alamkara.

original: // / de nas zhes te ;
analyzed: // / de nas zhes te ;
translated: Then,

original: mi bskyod phyag rgyar rab mchog bsgom //
analyzed: mi bskyod phyag rgyar rab mchog bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the supreme Akobhya as the seal.

original: zhes pa de gang sngon du song bas bsgom par bya zhes pa la sogs pa'i gdul bya'i spyod pa nges pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de gang sngon du song bas bsgom par bya zhes pa la sogs pa'i gdul bya'i spyod pa nges pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: This is the meditation that follows the ascertainment of the conduct of the disciples, such as what should be meditated upon first? and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje nyid skyes bu mchog rnams sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje nyid skyes bu mchog rnams sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the vajra of all the Tathagatas is the supreme beings, the vajra body and so forth.

original: de'i ngo bo aom yig la sogs pa de'i yul yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo aom yig la sogs pa de'i yul yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The nature of that is the syllable Om and so forth. The samadhi whose object is that is called that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i sngags ni aom yig la sogs pa rnams yin te de sngon du song ba ni rig pa'i skyes bu yin la bshad zin te de nyid mchog go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i sngags ni aom yig la sogs pa rnams yin te de sngon du song ba ni rig pa'i skyes bu yin la bshad zin te de nyid mchog go //
translated: The vajra-mantra of all the Tathagatas is the letter Om, etc. , and the one who is born of that knowledge is the person, and that has already been explained, and that is the best.

original: rdo rje gsum rnams ni yi ge aom la sogs pa'i yi ge nyid de sngags kyi mchog go //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum rnams ni yi ge aom la sogs pa'i yi ge nyid de sngags kyi mchog go //
translated: The three vajras are the letters Om, etc. , and that is the best mantra.

original: des phyag rgya chen po rig pa'i skyes bu'i bdag nyid rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des phyag rgya chen po rig pa'i skyes bu'i bdag nyid rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By that, one should meditate on the person who is the knowledge of the Great Seal in various aspects.

original: ye shes ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: ye shes ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Knowledge is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste ri bong can zhu bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste ri bong can zhu bar gyur pa'o //
translated: That itself is the vajra, the melted moon.

original: gang las des ni de thams cad kyi rnam pas byang chub kyi sems thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang las des ni de thams cad kyi rnam pas byang chub kyi sems thob par byed pa'o //
translated: From that, one should attain the Thought of Enlightenment in all its aspects.

original: yi ge aom ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yi ge aom ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The letter Om is the mirror-like knowledge.

original: de nyid snying po ste sa bon yin la gang las de'i sku rdo rje thob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid snying po ste sa bon yin la gang las de'i sku rdo rje thob pa'o //
translated: That itself is the essence, the seed, from which one attains the Body-vajra.

original: yi gi a'a: ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: yi gi a'a: ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi snying po'o //
translated: The letter Aḥ is the essence of the knowledge of discrimination.

original: byang chub bdag med pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: byang chub bdag med pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Enlightenment, which is the absence of self, is the ultimate realm.

original: 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma la yang yin te lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma la yang yin te lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is also the case in the past and the future, and the rest is as before.

original: yi ge h'um ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te snying po'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te snying po'o //
translated: The syllable hum is the pristine wisdom of the utterly pure ultimate realm, which is the essence.

original: so sor rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa thob pas yi ge aom la sogs pa yang sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: so sor rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa thob pas yi ge aom la sogs pa yang sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: The individual is the indivisibility of the three vajras, and so the syllables om and so forth are the body, speech, and mind.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje ni nam mkha' rdo rje yin te de yang chos kyi 'byung gnas so zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni nam mkha' rdo rje yin te de yang chos kyi 'byung gnas so zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The vajra of space is the vajra of space, and that is the source of phenomena, as has been explained.

original: @89a * // de'i dbus su gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni spyir brjod kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: @89a * // de'i dbus su gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni spyir brjod kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala situated in its center is a general statement, but it is the mandala of the moon.

original: kun du phyogs pa'i rdo rje ni sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: kun du phyogs pa'i rdo rje ni sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: The all-sided vajra is the crossed vajra situated on the variegated lotus.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje dkyil gnas padma ni zhes brjod pa'i phyir rdo rje thams cad de las skyes pa ni de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje dkyil gnas padma ni zhes brjod pa'i phyir rdo rje thams cad de las skyes pa ni de la gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it is said that the lotus is in the center of the vajra cross, all vajras are born from it, that is, they are located there.

original: de ru ni de las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: de ru ni de las skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: In that place, in the mandala born from it.

original: ye shes nyid rdo rje ste snying po ni bhr'um mo //
analyzed: ye shes nyid rdo rje ste snying po ni bhr'um mo //
translated: Wisdom itself is the vajra, and the essence is the syllable bhrūṃ.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: The vajra mandala

original: rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan gzhu 'dra sngo //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan gzhu 'dra sngo //
translated: is blue, marked with a banner, and shaped like a bow.

original: yam las byung ba g-yo ba'i rlung //🔽ram byung gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: yam las byung ba g-yo ba'i rlung // ram byung gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: It arises from yāṃ, and is the moving wind.🔽The clear mandala arises from raṃ,

original: bam byung chu yi dkyil 'khor dkar//
analyzed: bam byung chu yi dkyil 'khor dkar//
translated: and the white water mandala arises from vaṃ.

original: bh'um las mtshan ma'i zlum po'o //
analyzed: bh'um las mtshan ma'i zlum po'o //
translated: The sign of the circle arises from bhrūṃ.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: The dharma mandala

original: zur gsum ram las byung ba ste //
analyzed: zur gsum ram las byung ba ste //
translated: is triangular, arises from raṃ,

original: dmar po me yi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dmar po me yi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: and is the red fire mandala.

original: de skad du brjod pa /
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rdo rje gsal chos 'khor lo de //
analyzed: rdo rje gsal chos 'khor lo de //
translated: The vajra clear dharma wheel

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjer gtogs //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjer gtogs //
translated: belongs to the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: gnas su de yis bstan bya ste //🔽ye shes sku ni spro zhing bzla ;
analyzed: gnas su de yis bstan bya ste // ye shes sku ni spro zhing bzla ;
translated: It is taught that the place is

original: / zhes so //
analyzed: / zhes so //
translated: the wisdom body, which is emitted and repeated.

original: yi ge bhr'um ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par dag pa ston par byed pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa gnas gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rig ma dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi yan lag
analyzed: yi ge bhr'um ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par dag pa ston par byed pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa gnas gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rig ma dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi yan lag
translated: The syllable bhrūṃ is the declaration that the wheel with twelve spokes, which is the purification of the twelve links of dependent origination, is transformed into Vairocana with his consort.🔽The abode celestial mansion arises from the limbs of Vairocana.🔽It arises from the three vajras.

original: las byung ba'i gnas kyi gzhal yas khang pa rdo rje gsum las byung ba bsgom par bya'o zhes nges par gsungs so //
analyzed: las byung ba'i gnas kyi gzhal yas khang pa rdo rje gsum las byung ba bsgom par bya'o zhes nges par gsungs so //
translated: It should be visualized.

original: de gsungs pa /🔽bhr'um gyi 'khor lo las byung rig bcas pa'i //
analyzed: de gsungs pa / bhr'um gyi 'khor lo las byung rig bcas pa'i //
translated: That is declared.🔽From the wheel of bhrūṃ, together with the consort,

original: rnam par snang mdzad yan lag yang dag byung //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad yan lag yang dag byung //
translated: Vairocana arises from the limbs.

original: zhes so // snying po zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su chags pas chags pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // snying po zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su chags pas chags pa ste /
translated: The essence is the non-abiding nirvāṇa, which is passion due to attachment.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi yi ge ho gnyis so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi yi ge ho gnyis so //
translated: It is the two syllables hoḥ, which are the nature of wisdom and method.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the pleasing of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times.

original: gang gi tshe yang de rnams lam la gnas pa na khams gsum dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs la 'dod pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang de rnams lam la gnas pa na khams gsum dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs la 'dod pa skyed par byed do //
translated: When they abide in the path, they generate the wish for the body, speech, and mind that is endowed with the three realms.

original: de'i tshe shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i nyes pa mthong bas 'khor ba las ldog cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan bsngags pas de dang yang dag pa nyid skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i nyes pa mthong bas 'khor ba las ldog cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan bsngags pas de dang yang dag pa nyid skye par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, due to seeing the faults of samsara through wisdom, they turn away from samsara and due to praising the qualities of nirvana, they generate the wish for nirvana.

original: gang gi tshe yang bar skabs su sems can gyi gnod pa la sogs pas bse ru dang nyan thos kyi mya ngan las @89b 'das pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang bar skabs su sems can gyi gnod pa la sogs pas bse ru dang nyan thos kyi mya ngan las @89b 'das pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are harmed by sentient beings and so on, they generate the wish for the nirvana of solitary realizers and hearers.

original: de'i tshe snying rjes mya ngan las 'das pa la bzlog ste sems can 'di rnams bum pa bzang po zhes bya ba sogs pa'i yon tan bsngags pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par ldan pa nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snying rjes mya ngan las 'das pa la bzlog ste sems can 'di rnams bum pa bzang po zhes bya ba sogs pa'i yon tan bsngags pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par ldan pa nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, due to compassion, they turn away from nirvana and due to praising the qualities of sentient beings, they generate the wish for the nonabiding nirvana.

original: rim pa 'dis de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams yi ge gsum gyi ngo bo rnams te des na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pas mnyes par byed do //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams yi ge gsum gyi ngo bo rnams te des na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pas mnyes par byed do //
translated: By this process, their body, speech, and mind are the essence of the three syllables. Therefore, one delights them with attachment to non-abiding nirvana.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sems nyid ni /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sems nyid ni /
translated: The nature of mind, which is said to be OṀ, AḤ, and HŪṀ,

original: 'od ldan ho dang spel ba'i cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: 'od ldan ho dang spel ba'i cho ga bzhin //
translated: is endowed with light, and is combined with HOH, according to the rite.

original: zhes brjod pas so //
